analyzed: de nyid ni mi phyed pa yin pas na rdo rje'o //
translated: He is called “vajra” because he is indivisible.

original: chos kyi dbyings rnams par dag pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi ye shes chen mo mnga' bas na ye shes chen po'o //🔽de la bod pa ni rdo rje dbyings ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnams par dag pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi ye shes chen mo mnga' bas na ye shes chen po'o // de la bod pa ni rdo rje dbyings ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: He is called “great wisdom” because he possesses the great wisdom whose characteristic is the purity of the realm of truth.

original: mi phyed pa'i rigs mnga' ba'o //
analyzed: mi phyed pa'i rigs mnga' ba'o //
translated: He is called “Vajradhātu” because he possesses the family of the indivisible.

original: mkhas pa chen po zhes bya ba ni mkhyen pa chen po dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa chen po zhes bya ba ni mkhyen pa chen po dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He is called “great scholar” because he possesses great knowledge.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs te rdo rje gsum yang yin la mchog kyang yin pas na rdo rje gsum mchog go //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs te rdo rje gsum yang yin la mchog kyang yin pas na rdo rje gsum mchog go //
translated: He is called “supreme of the three vajras” because he is the supreme of the three vajras, body, speech, and mind.

original: dkyil 'khor gsum ni dkyil 'khor gsum gcig tu bsdus pa la dkyil 'khor gsum zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gsum ni dkyil 'khor gsum gcig tu bsdus pa la dkyil 'khor gsum zhes bya ste /
translated: The three mandalas are called the three mandalas because they are included in one mandala.

original: de ni kho na nyid do //
analyzed: de ni kho na nyid do //
translated: That is reality.

original: de nyid gcig tu bsdus pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i chos ston par mdzad pas na /
analyzed: de nyid gcig tu bsdus pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i chos ston par mdzad pas na /
translated: Since he teaches the Dharma of the body, speech, and mind vajras that are included in that reality alone,

original: rdo rje dbyings la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: he is Vajradhātu.

original: zhes bya'o // rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i tshul gyis gsal zhing snang bar mdzad pas na rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i tshul gyis gsal zhing snang bar mdzad pas na rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: Vairocana is the one who illuminates and appears in various modes, as in the phrase “Vairocana and so forth.”

original: de nyid ni dag pa che ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni dag pa che ste /
translated: He is the great purity

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is the essence of mirror-like pristine awareness.

original: rdo rje zhi ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba dang / zhi ba'i las la mnga' brnyes pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje zhi ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba dang / zhi ba'i las la mnga' brnyes pa'o //
translated: Vajra Pacifier is the one who has attained mastery over the pacifying activity and the complete pacification of all afflictive emotions.

original: dga' ba che zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dga' ba che zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Great joy is

original: dga' ba chen po zhes bya ba mchog tu dga' ba'i bde ba'i ngo bo chen po mnga' bas na dga' ba chen po ste de la bod pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba chen po zhes bya ba mchog tu dga' ba'i bde ba'i ngo bo chen po mnga' bas na dga' ba chen po ste de la bod pa'o //
translated: The great joy is the great essence of the bliss of supreme joy, and so it is the great joy, and one should understand it.

original: rang bzhin gyis ni 'od gsal mchog / ces bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la mchog dang gtso bor gyur pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ni 'od gsal mchog / ces bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la mchog dang gtso bor gyur pa ste /
translated: It is the supreme natural luminosity because it is the supreme and foremost of all the intuitions of omniscience.

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba yang yin la mchog kyang yin no zhes mtshams sbyar ba ste de la bod pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba yang yin la mchog kyang yin no zhes mtshams sbyar ba ste de la bod pa'o //
translated: It is the natural luminosity, and it is the supreme, and so it is the supreme natural luminosity, and one should understand it.

original: ston pa rdo rje phyag 'tshal lo //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ston pa rdo rje phyag 'tshal lo // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: I pay homage to the Teacher Vajra!

original: kye rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chos rnams ston par mdzad pa'i rdo rje la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bod pa'o //
analyzed: kye rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chos rnams ston par mdzad pa'i rdo rje la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bod pa'o //
translated: Thus, O! I pay homage to the Vajra who teaches the dharmas of natural luminosity!

original: rin chen zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rin chen zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The jewel and so forth:

original: rin chen ni byang chub kyi sems kyi rdo rje'o //
analyzed: rin chen ni byang chub kyi sems kyi rdo rje'o //
translated: The jewel is the vajra of the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: de nyid ni 'gro ba thams cad kyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pas na rgyal po ste de la bod pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni 'gro ba thams cad kyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pas na rgyal po ste de la bod pa'o //
translated: It is the king because it is endowed with the perfection of the aim of all beings, and so it is the jewel king, and one should understand it.

original: shin tu zab pa yin pas na rab tu zab pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu zab pa yin pas na rab tu zab pa'o //
translated: It is extremely profound, thus it is most profound.

original: rdo rje nam mkha' ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes te @215a * //
analyzed: rdo rje nam mkha' ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes te @215a * //
translated: Vajra space is the wisdom of equality.

original: des nam mkha'i bzhin du dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: des nam mkha'i bzhin du dri ma med pa'o //
translated: By it, one is stainless like space.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis rang bzhin gyis dag pa yin pas na rang bzhin dag pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis rang bzhin gyis dag pa yin pas na rang bzhin dag pa'o //
translated: It is naturally pure, since it is pure by its very nature.

original: nyon mongs pa dang las dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i bag chags kyi gos pa dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni gos pa med ces bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang las dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i bag chags kyi gos pa dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni gos pa med ces bya'o //
translated: It is unsoiled, since it is free from the stain of the propensities of the obscurations of afflictions, karma, and the knowable.

original: rdo rje'i sku la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: rdo rje'i sku la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the vajra body!

original: zhes bya ba ni sku rdo rje'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sku rdo rje'o //
translated: This is the vajra body.

original: rdo rje mi 'chi ni rdo rje tshe dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje mi 'chi ni rdo rje tshe dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: Vajra immortality is the vajra of limitless life.

original: de nyid ni khams gsum gyi bdag po'i 'byor pa mnga' bas na rgyal po che'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni khams gsum gyi bdag po'i 'byor pa mnga' bas na rgyal po che'o //
translated: He is the great king, since he possesses the wealth of being the lord of the three realms.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rtog pa ma lus pa dang bral bas ni mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rtog pa ma lus pa dang bral bas ni mi rtog pa'o //
translated: He is nonconceptual, since he is free from all concepts of subject and object.

original: nam mkha' rdo rje ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: nam mkha' rdo rje ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes te /
translated: Vajra space is the wisdom of discernment.

original: de 'dzin par mdzad pas na nam mkha' rdo rje 'dzin no //
analyzed: de 'dzin par mdzad pas na nam mkha' rdo rje 'dzin no //
translated: He is the sky-vajra-holder because he holds that.

original: 'dod chags pha rol phyin pa ni 'dod chags rnam par dag pa ste de mnyes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags pha rol phyin pa ni 'dod chags rnam par dag pa ste de mnyes pa'o //
translated: The perfection of passion is the purification of passion, and he delights in that.

original: rdo rje'i gsung la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: rdo rje'i gsung la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to Vajra Speech.

original: zhes bya ba ni chos ston par mdzad pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chos ston par mdzad pas so //
translated: This is because he teaches the Dharma.

original: don yod pa ni 'bras bu dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: don yod pa ni 'bras bu dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The successful one is the one with a result.

original: de nyid ni mi phyed pas na rdo rje ste de la bod pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni mi phyed pas na rdo rje ste de la bod pa'o //
translated: That itself is a vajra because it is indivisible, and he is the one who holds that.

original: yang dag cing phyin ci ma log pa'i rnam pas sangs rgyas pas na rdzogs sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: yang dag cing phyin ci ma log pa'i rnam pas sangs rgyas pas na rdzogs sangs rgyas so //
translated: He is the perfect Buddha because he is enlightened by the aspect of reality and non-error.

original: bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na bsam pa thams cad rdzogs mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na bsam pa thams cad rdzogs mdzad pa'o //
translated: He is the fulfiller of all wishes because he has become the essence of the successful action intuition.

original: dag pa ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo ste de nyid las yang dag par byung bas na rang bzhin dag pa nyid las byung ba'o //
analyzed: dag pa ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo ste de nyid las yang dag par byung bas na rang bzhin dag pa nyid las byung ba'o //
translated: Purity is the essence of natural luminosity, and he is the one who has arisen from that, so he is the one who has arisen from natural purity.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to Vajrasattva.

original: zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pa'i phyir ro //🔽'bar ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'bar ba ni 'od dang ldan pa ste de lta bu'i aom gyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i rlung me'i dkyil 'khor la padma'i snod gnas shing de'i bdud rtsi lnga bzhag la aom gyis byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pa'i phyir ro // 'bar ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'bar ba ni 'od dang ldan pa ste de lta bu'i aom gyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i rlung me'i dkyil 'khor la padma'i snod gnas shing de'i bdud rtsi lnga bzhag la aom gyis byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: This is because it has become the nature of nondual intuition.

original: rab tu sbar zhing kun du 'bar bar byas la de nas yi ge gsum mngon par bzlas te thub pa'i dbang po nang du chud par bsam par bya ba dang / ye shes nyid du bdud rtsi ste kham gsum pa'i 'chi ba nye bar zhi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu sbar zhing kun du 'bar bar byas la de nas yi ge gsum mngon par bzlas te thub pa'i dbang po nang du chud par bsam par bya ba dang / ye shes nyid du bdud rtsi ste kham gsum pa'i 'chi ba nye bar zhi ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The blazing and so on: the wind, endowed with light, is blessed by the syllable om, and the vessel of the lotus is placed on the mandala of fire. Having placed the five ambrosias there, they are blessed by the syllable om, and having been well ignited and made to blaze, one should then recite the three syllables and imagine the Lord of Sages entering inside, and the ambrosia is the nature of intuition, because it pacifies death in the third moment.

original: de ltar de'i ngo bo nyid du bsams nas rang gi lces la yi ge h'um las rdo rje rtse lnga pa'i bdag nyid can gyi @215b lce bsams la / bdud rtsi lnga de'i snying ga'i zla ba'i dbus na ma lus pa'i rgyal ba'i 'khor lo lta bu des🔽tshim par bya zhing blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar de'i ngo bo nyid du bsams nas rang gi lces la yi ge h'um las rdo rje rtse lnga pa'i bdag nyid can gyi @215b lce bsams la / bdud rtsi lnga de'i snying ga'i zla ba'i dbus na ma lus pa'i rgyal ba'i 'khor lo lta bu des tshim par bya zhing blta bar bya'o //
translated: and one should visualize the five nectars in the center of the moon in the heart of that [vajra], and one should satisfy and view the wheel of all the Victors.

original: 'di dag ni dkyil 'khor gyi rgyal po mchog gi ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'di dag ni dkyil 'khor gyi rgyal po mchog gi ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: These are the supreme samādhi of the king of maṇḍalas.

original: snying po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la snying po'i 'od zer dpag tu med pas sprul pa'i thub pa rnams kyis mi shes pa kun du nges par bsal nas 'gro ba ma lus pa rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su byas te /
analyzed: snying po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la snying po'i 'od zer dpag tu med pas sprul pa'i thub pa rnams kyis mi shes pa kun du nges par bsal nas 'gro ba ma lus pa rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su byas te /
translated: As for the light rays of the essence, and so on, the emanated sages with immeasurable light rays from the essence dispel all ignorance and make all beings perfect buddhas.

original: rang gi sngags kyi nang du chud par byas la /
analyzed: rang gi sngags kyi nang du chud par byas la /
translated: Having done that, one should cause them to enter one's mantra.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa mi rtog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas brtags nas rang gi snying gar dri ma med pa'i zla ba la gnas pa'i mtshan ma la gnas pa'i gsang sngags dam pa'i gzugs su rang gi yid 'ong dang ldan par yongs su bsgom🔽par bya'o zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa mi rtog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas brtags nas rang gi snying gar dri ma med pa'i zla ba la gnas pa'i mtshan ma la gnas pa'i gsang sngags dam pa'i gzugs su rang gi yid 'ong dang ldan par yongs su bsgom par bya'o zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Having investigated the aspect of form, etc., as non-conceptual, one should visualize the form of the mantra deity in one's heart, abiding in the sign located on the stainless moon, endowed with one's own beauty.

original: snying po'i 'od zer zhes bya ba ni ye shes sems dpa'i snying po'i 'od zer rnams te /
analyzed: snying po'i 'od zer zhes bya ba ni ye shes sems dpa'i snying po'i 'od zer rnams te /
translated: The light rays of the essence are the light rays of the wisdom being's essence.

original: de dpag tu med pas sprul pa yang yin la thub pa'i dbang po yang yin pas na snying po'i 'od zer dpag med kyis sprul pa'i thub pas zhes bya ba de ltar mtshams sbyar te /
analyzed: de dpag tu med pas sprul pa yang yin la thub pa'i dbang po yang yin pas na snying po'i 'od zer dpag med kyis sprul pa'i thub pas zhes bya ba de ltar mtshams sbyar te /
translated: Since those are immeasurable, they are emanations and also lords of sages. Therefore, it is connected in this way: By the immeasurable light rays of the essence, the emanated sages.

original: byed pa por gyur pa de rnams kyis /
analyzed: byed pa por gyur pa de rnams kyis /
translated: Those who have become agents

original: mi shes kun du nges bsal nas //
analyzed: mi shes kun du nges bsal nas //
translated: having completely removed all ignorance,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: in this,

original: mi shes pa ste ma rig pa kun du dngos po thams cad kyis nges par bsal zhing spangs pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa ste ma rig pa kun du dngos po thams cad kyis nges par bsal zhing spangs pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which is called “the complete removal and abandonment of ignorance, i.e., of non-knowledge, by all things” is that.

original: de lta bus 'gro ba ma lus pa rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su byas nas /
analyzed: de lta bus 'gro ba ma lus pa rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su byas nas /
translated: Having made all of the world into perfect Buddhas by means of that,

original: rang gi gsang sngags nang du chud par bya //
analyzed: rang gi gsang sngags nang du chud par bya //
translated: one should cause one’s own mantra to enter.

original: zhes pa ste ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka'i snying po'i nang du'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ste ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka'i snying po'i nang du'o //
translated: That is to say, it is into the essence of the heart of the wisdom-being.

original: gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa'o //🔽gang gi phyir rnam pa'i ngo bo nyid de kun du brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang gis mtshan nyid dang bral zhing spangs pa yin pa'i mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid can gyis mthong zhing snang ba yin pa'i rgyu des na 'dzin pa po ni mngon sum la sogs
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa'o // gang gi phyir rnam pa'i ngo bo nyid de kun du brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang gis mtshan nyid dang bral zhing spangs pa yin pa'i mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid can gyis mthong zhing snang ba yin pa'i rgyu des na 'dzin pa po ni mngon sum la sogs
translated: “Form, etc.” refers to the aggregate of form, etc.

original: pa'i rnam par shes par yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: pa'i rnam par shes par yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Because of the fact that the essence of the aspect is free from and abandons the imagined and the relative natures, it is the direct perception of the essence of the aspect. Because of the fact that it is seen and appears, the perceiver does not exist as the consciousnesses of direct perception, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi gzung ba rnams kyang cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //🔽gzhan pa rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi tshad mas kyang gzugs la sogs pa nye bar dmigs par mi 'gyur @216a * //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi gzung ba rnams kyang cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no // gzhan pa rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi tshad mas kyang gzugs la sogs pa nye bar dmigs par mi 'gyur @216a * //
translated: The apprehended objects, which are characterized by form, etc., also do not exist in the least.

original: te ; 'brel pa zhes bya ba de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis kyang mthong ba med pas shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: te ; 'brel pa zhes bya ba de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis kyang mthong ba med pas shes pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the perception of form, etc. by a valid cognition, which is characterized by inference, because the so-called relation, which is characterized by identity and causality, is not seen, i.e., is not known.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For inference is preceded by perception.

original: de yang phyogs kyi chos bzung nas bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa'i 'brel pa dran pa ni /
analyzed: de yang phyogs kyi chos bzung nas bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa'i 'brel pa dran pa ni /
translated: Moreover, after the property of the subject has been apprehended, the relation between the probandum and the proof is recalled.

original: phyis rjes su dpag pa 'jug pas na rjes su dpag pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: phyis rjes su dpag pa 'jug pas na rjes su dpag pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: Subsequently, inference occurs, and thus it is called inference.

original: bde ba la sogs pa rnam par shes pa gzugs la sogs pa de yongs su 'dzin par byed pa'i dbye ba ni 'ga' yang yod par ma mthong la rgyu des cig car de dus mtshungs par shes shing nye bar dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa rnam par shes pa gzugs la sogs pa de yongs su 'dzin par byed pa'i dbye ba ni 'ga' yang yod par ma mthong la rgyu des cig car de dus mtshungs par shes shing nye bar dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa
translated: But we do not see any difference in the consciousness of pleasure and so on that apprehends form and so on. And because of that, they are simultaneously cognized and observed, just like form and so on.

original: bzhin du bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa 'di dag yongs su 'dzin pa por yod pa ma yin zhing 'dzin par byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzhin du bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa 'di dag yongs su 'dzin pa por yod pa ma yin zhing 'dzin par byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, like form and so on, these consciousnesses of pleasure and so on are not the appropriator, and they do not appropriate.

original: yang na sems ni gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: yang na sems ni gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba ste /
translated: Or, the mind is free from the aspect of form and so on.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi gzung ba'i mtshan nyid dang bral zhing med pa mngon sum ste rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis mthong zhing shes pa de ni 'dzin pa po ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi gzung ba'i mtshan nyid dang bral zhing med pa mngon sum ste rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis mthong zhing shes pa de ni 'dzin pa po ma yin te /
translated: The mind that is free from the aspect of form and so on, free from the characteristic of an apprehended object, is seen and known by direct perception, by reflexive awareness. It is not the appropriator.

original: gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba yin pa des na de ni 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba yin pa des na de ni 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: Because it is free from the aspect of form and so on, it is not the appropriator.

original: gzung bar bya ba med pas 'dzin pa po yang med do //
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba med pas 'dzin pa po yang med do //
translated: Since there is no object to be grasped, there is no grasping subject.

original: gang gi phyir sems gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba yin pa des na gzung ba rnams kyang ci yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba yin pa des na gzung ba rnams kyang ci yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Since the mind is free from the aspects of form, etc., therefore, the objects of grasping do not exist at all.

original: gzugs la sogs pa gzung pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa gzung pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro /
translated: Because form, etc., are not objects of grasping.

original: kyang zhes smos ba ni 'dzin pa po'i shes pa yang cung zad kyang med do zhes ston to //
analyzed: kyang zhes smos ba ni 'dzin pa po'i shes pa yang cung zad kyang med do zhes ston to //
translated: The word “also” indicates that there is not the slightest bit of a consciousness that is a grasping subject.

original: de bas na sems ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa las nges par grol ba yin no //🔽'brel pa gzhan gyis kyang ni mthong ba med //
analyzed: de bas na sems ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa las nges par grol ba yin no // 'brel pa gzhan gyis kyang ni mthong ba med //
translated: Therefore, the mind is definitely free from the grasped and the grasper.🔽Nor is it seen by any other relation.

original: ces bya ba ni de'i bdag nyid la sogs pa'i 'brel pas kyang mthong zhing nye bar dmigs pa med do //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni de'i bdag nyid la sogs pa'i 'brel pas kyang mthong zhing nye bar dmigs pa med do //
translated: Nor is it seen or apprehended by any other relation, such as identity.

original: de yang re zhig shes pa dang shes bya gnyis ni de'i bdag nyid can gyi mtshan nyid du shes par byar mi rung ste mdo sde pa dang bye brag tu smra ba dag gis shes pa las logs shig na yang shes bya yod par khas len pa'i phyir
analyzed: de yang re zhig shes pa dang shes bya gnyis ni de'i bdag nyid can gyi mtshan nyid du shes par byar mi rung ste mdo sde pa dang bye brag tu smra ba dag gis shes pa las logs shig na yang shes bya yod par khas len pa'i phyir
translated: Moreover, consciousness and the object of consciousness are not suitable to be known as having the character of being the same nature, because Sautrāntikas and Vaibhāṣikas assert that the object of consciousness exists separately from consciousness.

original: ro // de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid can du @216b 'brel pa yang ma yin te zhes pa ni shes bya med par yang rmi lam la sogs par shes pa gsal por 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ro // de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid can du @216b 'brel pa yang ma yin te zhes pa ni shes bya med par yang rmi lam la sogs par shes pa gsal por 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are also not related as having the character of arising from that because even without an object of consciousness, clear consciousness arises in dreams and so on.

original: yul la sogs pa nges pa las rnam par shes pa skye ba yin mod kyi de yang de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi dbang nyid las yin gyi phyi'i shes bya'i bdag nyid las ni ma yin no zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: yul la sogs pa nges pa las rnam par shes pa skye ba yin mod kyi de yang de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi dbang nyid las yin gyi phyi'i shes bya'i bdag nyid las ni ma yin no zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: Although consciousness arises from the ascertainment of objects and so on, that should be viewed as being due to the power of the condition of the immediately preceding moment and not due to the nature of an external object of consciousness.

original: yang na yul la sogs pa'i nges pa ni rmi lam la sogs pa dang 'dra bar grub pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na yul la sogs pa'i nges pa ni rmi lam la sogs pa dang 'dra bar grub pa yin no //
translated: Or, the ascertainment of objects and so on is established to be like dreams and so on.

original: bde sogs de ni yongs su 'dzin pas na //
analyzed: bde sogs de ni yongs su 'dzin pas na //
translated: Since it fully apprehends pleasure and so on,

original: bya ba 'ga' yang yod par ma mthong ste //
analyzed: bya ba 'ga' yang yod par ma mthong ste //
translated: it is not seen to have any function.

original: zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa'i shes pa'i bya ba gzung ba so sor rtog pa'i mtshan nyid can gang yin pa de ni yongs su 'dzin pa na zhes pa gzugs la sogs pa yongs su 'dzin par byed pa'i tshe na bya ba 'ga' yang yod
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa'i shes pa'i bya ba gzung ba so sor rtog pa'i mtshan nyid can gang yin pa de ni yongs su 'dzin pa na zhes pa gzugs la sogs pa yongs su 'dzin par byed pa'i tshe na bya ba 'ga' yang yod
translated: The function of the consciousness of pleasure and so on is to apprehend and discriminate the object. When it fully apprehends form and so on, it is not seen to have any function.

original: par ma mthong ste mi shes so //
analyzed: par ma mthong ste mi shes so //
translated: It is not seen to have any function because it is not known to have any.

original: cig car shes pa'i phyir ni gzugs sogs bzhin //
analyzed: cig car shes pa'i phyir ni gzugs sogs bzhin //
translated: Because it simultaneously cognizes, like form and so on,

original: 'di dag 'dzin pa por ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'di dag 'dzin pa por ni yod ma yin //
translated: it is not the apprehender of these.

original: zhes bya ba ni cig car dus mtshungs par shes shing nye bar dmigs par gyur pa na ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa gzhan gyi 'dzin pa por mi 'gyur zhing 'dzin par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni cig car dus mtshungs par shes shing nye bar dmigs par gyur pa na ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa gzhan gyi 'dzin pa por mi 'gyur zhing 'dzin par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: When it simultaneously cognizes and observes pleasure and so on, how could it not be the apprehender of these? It is not the apprehender of these.

original: gcig la gcig phan gdags par bya ba dang / phan 'dogs pa med par byed pa de bzhin du bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa yang gzugs la sogs pa dang dus gcig tu shes shing rtogs pa na gzugs la sogs pa dang 'dra bar 'dzin pa por 'gyur ba ma yin zhing 'dzin pa por
analyzed: gcig la gcig phan gdags par bya ba dang / phan 'dogs pa med par byed pa de bzhin du bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa yang gzugs la sogs pa dang dus gcig tu shes shing rtogs pa na gzugs la sogs pa dang 'dra bar 'dzin pa por 'gyur ba ma yin zhing 'dzin pa por
translated: Just as the right and left horns of a single ox are not the appropriator and the appropriated, and just as the right and left horns of a single ox are not the object of knowledge and the knower, in the same way, when consciousness of form and so on is known and cognized simultaneously with form and so on, it is not the apprehender of form and so on, and it is not the object of cognition.

original: med de / dus mtshungs par nye bar dmigs pa dag ni rva g-yas pa dang g-yon pa 'dra ba gcig la phan gdags par bya ba dang / phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: med de / dus mtshungs par nye bar dmigs pa dag ni rva g-yas pa dang g-yon pa 'dra ba gcig la phan gdags par bya ba dang / phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because those that are observed simultaneously, like the right and left horns of an ox, cannot be the appropriator and the appropriated, and they cannot be the object of knowledge and the knower.

original: gzung ba dag kyang ci yang yod min te //
analyzed: gzung ba dag kyang ci yang yod min te //
translated: There is no object of apprehension at all.

original: zhes ji skad bshad pa'i gzung ba med pa de de ltar spros nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir bshad pa yin la /
analyzed: zhes ji skad bshad pa'i gzung ba med pa de de ltar spros nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir bshad pa yin la /
translated: As it was explained, the absence of an object of apprehension is taught by elaborating on that.

original: da ni spyod pa la sogs pa tshar gcad par bya ba'i phyir dkar po la sogs pa gang zhig mthong ba rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: da ni spyod pa la sogs pa tshar gcad par bya ba'i phyir dkar po la sogs pa gang zhig mthong ba rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: is seen, etc.”

original: gzugs dkar po la sogs pa mthong ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs dkar po la sogs pa mthong ba ste /
translated: White, etc., forms are seen.

original: sngon gyi dus su mthong ba gang yin pa //
analyzed: sngon gyi dus su mthong ba gang yin pa //
translated: Whatever was seen in the past

original: de nyid dus gzhan dag tu mthong mi 'gyur //🔽zhes bya @217a * //
analyzed: de nyid dus gzhan dag tu mthong mi 'gyur // zhes bya @217a * //
translated: is not seen at another time.

original: ba sngar nye bar dmigs pa'i dkar po la sogs pa de nyid dus phyis mi mthong zhing shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ba sngar nye bar dmigs pa'i dkar po la sogs pa de nyid dus phyis mi mthong zhing shes pa ma yin no //
translated: The white, etc., that was previously perceived is not seen later, is not cognized.

original: ci'i phyir mi mthong zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi mthong zhe na /
translated: Why is it not seen?

original: 'di gnyis rtag tu gcig la gcig 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di gnyis rtag tu gcig la gcig 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “Because these two are always mutually exclusive.”

original: sngar nye bar dmigs pa dang phyis nye bar dmigs pa gnyis phan tshun 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir sngar gyi dngos po dus phyis yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sngar nye bar dmigs pa dang phyis nye bar dmigs pa gnyis phan tshun 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir sngar gyi dngos po dus phyis yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Because the two, the previous perception and the later perception, are mutually exclusive, the previous thing does not exist at a later time.

original: sngon gyi shes dang shes bya yis //
analyzed: sngon gyi shes dang shes bya yis //
translated: The past consciousness and the object of consciousness

original: rang bzhin gyis ni rjes 'jug na //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ni rjes 'jug na //
translated: are essentially sequential.

original: snga ma'i shes pa phyi mar 'gyur //
analyzed: snga ma'i shes pa phyi mar 'gyur //
translated: The former consciousness becomes the latter.

original: de bzhin phyi ma snga mar 'gyur //
analyzed: de bzhin phyi ma snga mar 'gyur //
translated: And likewise the latter becomes the former.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: In this way.

original: bde ba la sogs dag dang mtshungs //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs dag dang mtshungs //
translated: Like pleasure and so on.

original: zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal gnyis dang 'dra bar gcig la gcig phan tshun 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal gnyis dang 'dra bar gcig la gcig phan tshun 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Like pleasure and pain, they are mutually exclusive.

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du 'gal ba yin gyi lan 'ga' ni ma yin no zhes bya bar shes so //
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du 'gal ba yin gyi lan 'ga' ni ma yin no zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: Always means that they are mutually exclusive at all times, not just sometimes.

original: de bas na dngos po rnams kyi sngon dang phyi ma'i rang bzhin gcig pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: de bas na dngos po rnams kyi sngon dang phyi ma'i rang bzhin gcig pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Therefore, the former and latter natures of things are not identical.

original: 'dis ni rgyun du rtogs pa'i gcig pa nyid nges par bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rgyun du rtogs pa'i gcig pa nyid nges par bsal ba yin no //
translated: This refutes the identity of things that are realized through continuity.

original: da ni rigs par rtogs pa'i gcig pa nyid bsal ba'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: da ni rigs par rtogs pa'i gcig pa nyid bsal ba'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Now, in order to refute the identity of things that are realized through reasoning, it is said:

original: 'dir rigs pa can la sogs pa dag ni cha shas can gyi rang bzhin gcig pu 'di nyid rdul phra rab gnyis la sogs pa'i rim gyis phra rab rnams kyis brtsams pa'i 'bras bu'i rdzas gang yin pa de ni skad cig ma ma yin pa dang gcig pu🔽las 'da' bar mi byed do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'dir rigs pa can la sogs pa dag ni cha shas can gyi rang bzhin gcig pu 'di nyid rdul phra rab gnyis la sogs pa'i rim gyis phra rab rnams kyis brtsams pa'i 'bras bu'i rdzas gang yin pa de ni skad cig ma ma yin pa dang gcig pu las 'da' bar mi byed do zhes zer ro //
translated: Here, the Naiyāyikas and others say: This very single nature of the whole is not a momentary thing, and it does not pass beyond being a single thing, whatever substance is the result composed of subtle particles, such as two subtle particles, in stages.

original: de rnams kyi phyogs 'di yang sdig pa can las kyang sdig pa can yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir thog mtha' la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te gzugs la sogs pa gang yin pa 'di dag ni rang bzhin gyis gcig pa nyid ma yin no
analyzed: de rnams kyi phyogs 'di yang sdig pa can las kyang sdig pa can yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir thog mtha' la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te gzugs la sogs pa gang yin pa 'di dag ni rang bzhin gyis gcig pa nyid ma yin no
translated: This position of theirs is also a sin among sins. To show this, he says, “The beginning, end, etc.,” and so on. These things such as form are not intrinsically one.

original: // ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: // ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: thog mtha' la sogs bye brag snang bas na //
analyzed: thog mtha' la sogs bye brag snang bas na //
translated: Because the beginning, end, etc. appear as distinct.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Here, “etc.” means the middle, etc.

original: thog ma'i sgras ni ka ba la sogs pa'i steng gi cha gzung ngo //
analyzed: thog ma'i sgras ni ka ba la sogs pa'i steng gi cha gzung ngo //
translated: By the word “beginning,” the upper part of a pillar, etc. is taken.

original: mtha' ma'i sgras ni 'og ma'i cha gzung ngo //
analyzed: mtha' ma'i sgras ni 'og ma'i cha gzung ngo //
translated: By the word “end,” the lower part is taken.

original: yang sogs pa'i sgras ni dbus ma'i cha gzung ngo //
analyzed: yang sogs pa'i sgras ni dbus ma'i cha gzung ngo //
translated: The word “etc.” includes the middle part.

original: bye brag ces bya ba ni cha shas nyid du'o //
analyzed: bye brag ces bya ba ni cha shas nyid du'o //
translated: “ Distinctions” means the parts.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: ka ba la sogs pa gcig pu nyid la thog ma dang dbus dang tha ma'i cha'i @217b bye brag gis rang bzhin tha dad par nye bar dmigs pa yod pa la gcig pa nyid du khas blangs nas khyed cag ltar rang nyid slu bar ji ltar byed /
analyzed: ka ba la sogs pa gcig pu nyid la thog ma dang dbus dang tha ma'i cha'i @217b bye brag gis rang bzhin tha dad par nye bar dmigs pa yod pa la gcig pa nyid du khas blangs nas khyed cag ltar rang nyid slu bar ji ltar byed /
translated: Since the distinctions of beginning, middle, and end are observed in a single pillar, etc., how can you, accepting that they are one, deceive yourselves?

original: 'dir yang tshad ma gzhan dag ni med mod kyi /
analyzed: 'dir yang tshad ma gzhan dag ni med mod kyi /
translated: Here, although there are no other valid cognitions,

original: 'on kyang mngon sum nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang mngon sum nyid yin no //
translated: nevertheless, it is direct perception.

original: zhes bstan pa'i phyir snang bas na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa'i phyir snang bas na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to teach this, he says, “Because of appearance,”

original: mngon sum nyid kyis de ltar nye bar dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: mngon sum nyid kyis de ltar nye bar dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: up to “it is observed in that way by direct perception.”

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: dkar po la sogs rnam pa ni //🔽gcig pu la yang shes pa dag / thog ma dbus mtha'i dbye ba yis //
analyzed: dkar po la sogs rnam pa ni // gcig pu la yang shes pa dag / thog ma dbus mtha'i dbye ba yis //
translated: The aspects of white, etc.🔽Are observed as only various

original: sna tshogs kho nar nye bar dmigs //
analyzed: sna tshogs kho nar nye bar dmigs //
translated: By the distinctions of beginning, middle, and end.

original: zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: yang na thog mtha' la sogs bye brag snang bas na //🔽gzugs la sogs pa 'di dag gcig ma yin //
analyzed: yang na thog mtha' la sogs bye brag snang bas na // gzugs la sogs pa 'di dag gcig ma yin //
translated: Or else, because of the appearance of differences in the beginning, end, etc.,🔽these forms, etc. are not one.

original: zhes bya ba ni rags par gtogs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa ni rang bzhin gcig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rags par gtogs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa ni rang bzhin gcig pa ma yin no //
translated: The forms, etc. that are included in the gross are not of one nature.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: thog mtha' la sogs bye brag snang bas na //
analyzed: thog mtha' la sogs bye brag snang bas na //
translated: Because of the appearance of differences in the beginning, end, etc.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This is what is meant.

original: thog ma dang tha ma dang dbus dang shar la sogs pa'i dbye ba rnams su shes pas gcig pa nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma dang dbus dang shar la sogs pa'i dbye ba rnams su shes pas gcig pa nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: Since they are known as having a division into beginning, end, middle, east, etc., they are not one.

original: dbye ba med pa la bya na thog ma dang tha ma la sogs pa'i dbye ba yod pas 'di ni gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: dbye ba med pa la bya na thog ma dang tha ma la sogs pa'i dbye ba yod pas 'di ni gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: If one means non-division, then since there is a division into beginning, end, etc., they are not one.

original: gcig pa nyid dang du ma nyid ni phan tshun 'gal ba yin pas gcig pa nyid du bsdur ji ltar rung /
analyzed: gcig pa nyid dang du ma nyid ni phan tshun 'gal ba yin pas gcig pa nyid du bsdur ji ltar rung /
translated: Since one and many are mutually exclusive, how can one be included in the other?

original: de bas na gzugs la sogs pa cha shas can gcig pa nyid du mi 'grub po //
analyzed: de bas na gzugs la sogs pa cha shas can gcig pa nyid du mi 'grub po //
translated: Therefore, the establishment of form, etc. as one whole is not valid.

original: cha shas can gcig tu ma gyur na de lta na ni rdul phra rab 'dus pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin du ma zhig yin no zhes /
analyzed: cha shas can gcig tu ma gyur na de lta na ni rdul phra rab 'dus pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin du ma zhig yin no zhes /
translated: If the whole does not become one with its parts, then it is many in nature, because it is an aggregation of atoms.

original: gang zhig sems dpa' de'i phyir da ni du ma nyid kyang dgag par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang zhig sems dpa' de'i phyir da ni du ma nyid kyang dgag par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to refute its being many, he says:

original: du ma'i gzugs su min pa'ang de dang 'dra //🔽zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: du ma'i gzugs su min pa'ang de dang 'dra // zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Nor is it a form of many atoms.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: phra rab rnams kyang mthong ba ma yin pas //
analyzed: phra rab rnams kyang mthong ba ma yin pas //
translated: Because the atoms are not seen.

original: zhes bya ba smos te rdul phra rab re re'i ngo bor yang mthong ba ma yin zhing shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te rdul phra rab re re'i ngo bor yang mthong ba ma yin zhing shes pa ma yin te /
translated: The nature of each atom is not seen, is not known.

original: rdul phra rab rnams ni rang gi ngo bor snang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams ni rang gi ngo bor snang ba ma yin te /
translated: Atoms do not appear in their own nature.

original: rdul phra rab cha shas med pa dag ni de ltar mi snang ba'i phyir du ma'i gzugs su min pa zhes bya ba 'dis bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: rdul phra rab cha shas med pa dag ni de ltar mi snang ba'i phyir du ma'i gzugs su min pa zhes bya ba 'dis bkag pa yin no //
translated: Since partless atoms do not appear in that way, this refutes the claim that they are not a form of many atoms.

original: de dang 'dra zhes bya ba ni ji ltar cha shas can gyi ngo bo la thog ma dang dbus dang tha ma la sogs pa'i dbye ba nye bar dmigs pas gcig tu mi @218a * //
analyzed: de dang 'dra zhes bya ba ni ji ltar cha shas can gyi ngo bo la thog ma dang dbus dang tha ma la sogs pa'i dbye ba nye bar dmigs pas gcig tu mi @218a * //
translated: “Like that” means that just as the nature of a whole is observed to be divided into a beginning, middle, end, and so on, it is not singular.

original: 'grub pa de bzhin du rdul phra rab du ma'i ngo bo yang /🔽drug gis cig car sbyar bas na //
analyzed: 'grub pa de bzhin du rdul phra rab du ma'i ngo bo yang / drug gis cig car sbyar bas na //
translated: “The same applies to it” means that just as the nature of the whole is not established as one because the distinctions of beginning, middle, end, and so on are observed, in the same way, the nature of many subtle particles is also not established.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa phyogs kyi dbye bas med par sun phyung bas 'grub pa ma yin no //🔽yang na min pa 'ang de dang 'dra //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa phyogs kyi dbye bas med par sun phyung bas 'grub pa ma yin no // yang na min pa 'ang de dang 'dra //
translated: “It is not established because of the refutation by the distinctions of direction” means that the nature of many subtle particles is not established because of the refutation by the distinctions of direction, such as “Six subtle particles are joined simultaneously,” and so on.

original: zhes bya ba ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gcig pa med pa ltar du ma'i rang bzhin yang de bzhin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gcig pa med pa ltar du ma'i rang bzhin yang de bzhin no zhes ston to //
translated: “The same applies to nonexistence” means that just as the nature of one form does not exist, the nature of many also does not exist in the same way.

original: de ltar rags pa'i gcig pa nyid dang du ma nyid sun phyung nas phra bar gtogs pa'i gcig pa nyid dang du ma nyid sun dbyung bar bya ba'i phyir /🔽rdul phran cha shas med pa nyid kyang ni //
analyzed: de ltar rags pa'i gcig pa nyid dang du ma nyid sun phyung nas phra bar gtogs pa'i gcig pa nyid dang du ma nyid sun dbyung bar bya ba'i phyir /🔽rdul phran cha shas med pa nyid kyang ni //
translated: Having thus refuted the gross one and many, in order to refute the subtle one and many, it is said, “Even the subtle particle, partless, is not one.”

original: phra rab du ma 'dus pa yod min pas //
analyzed: phra rab du ma 'dus pa yod min pas //
translated: Since there is no aggregation of many subtle particles,

original: sa yi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa yi gzugs //
analyzed: sa yi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa yi gzugs //
translated: the form of the earth mandala, etc.

original: bsags pa 'ga' yang 'dir ni med par 'gyur //
analyzed: bsags pa 'ga' yang 'dir ni med par 'gyur //
translated: will not exist here as a collection.

original: zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: rdul phra rab rnams ni cha shas can ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir yan lag can nyid ma yin pas gzhan dag rang nyid du ma nyid du mi 'dod de ;
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams ni cha shas can ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir yan lag can nyid ma yin pas gzhan dag rang nyid du ma nyid du mi 'dod de ;
translated: Since subtle particles are not divisible, they do not have parts. Therefore, others do not assert that they are multiple by nature.

original: cha shas ni du ma'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir de bkag nas rdul phra rab tsam du yod par khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cha shas ni du ma'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir de bkag nas rdul phra rab tsam du yod par khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since parts have the nature of being multiple, they are refuted and subtle particles are accepted as existing.

original: rdul phra rab cha shas med na ni rdul phra rab du ma 'dus pas yongs su bskor ba yod pa ma yin pas sa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i gzugs bsags pa'i rab tu dbye ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab cha shas med na ni rdul phra rab du ma 'dus pas yongs su bskor ba yod pa ma yin pas sa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i gzugs bsags pa'i rab tu dbye ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If subtle particles are partless, then since there is no aggregation of many subtle particles, the form of the earth mandala, etc., will not exist here as a collection.

original: de yang phyi rol gyi don yod par smra ba 'di dag gi gzhung lugs ni rdul phra rab rnams phan tshun phrad pa las rdul phra rab gnyis la sogs pa'i rim gyis cha shas can du ma la sogs pa bskyed pa'i sgo nas cha shas can gyi rdzas
analyzed: de yang phyi rol gyi don yod par smra ba 'di dag gi gzhung lugs ni rdul phra rab rnams phan tshun phrad pa las rdul phra rab gnyis la sogs pa'i rim gyis cha shas can du ma la sogs pa bskyed pa'i sgo nas cha shas can gyi rdzas
translated: In the scriptural systems of these proponents of external objects, the primary elements generate composite substances through the process of particles

original: gtso bo skyed par byed par 'dod do ;
analyzed: gtso bo skyed par byed par 'dod do ;
translated: of the elements contacting each other, generating two particles and so on, and then gradually generating many composite particles.

original: / de yang 'di ltar dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: / de yang 'di ltar dpyad par bya ste /
translated: This should be analyzed as follows.

original: dbus kyi rdul phra rab gang yin pa de la rdul phra rab gzhan dag 'byar bar byed pa na /
analyzed: dbus kyi rdul phra rab gang yin pa de la rdul phra rab gzhan dag 'byar bar byed pa na /
translated: When other particles adhere to the central particle,

original: ci bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'byar bar byed dam /
analyzed: ci bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'byar bar byed dam /
translated: do they adhere to it by their whole entity?

original: 'on te cha shas kyis 'byar bar byed /🔽de la re zhig cha shas kyis 'byar bar ni mi byed de /
analyzed: 'on te cha shas kyis 'byar bar byed / de la re zhig cha shas kyis 'byar bar ni mi byed de /
translated: Or do they adhere to it by part?

original: rdul phra rab de cha shas med pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab de cha shas med pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: First, they do not adhere by part because it is accepted that that particle is partless.

original: bdag nyid thams cad kyis phrad na ni 'gro ba thams cad rdul phra rab tsam du 'gyur gyi sa sa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i gzugs can gyi bsags par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad kyis phrad na ni 'gro ba thams cad rdul phra rab tsam du 'gyur gyi sa sa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i gzugs can gyi bsags par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If they were to meet with their entire bodies, all going would be reduced to the size of a mere atom, and the accumulation of matter such as the earth mandala and so on would not occur.

original: gang gi phyir rdul phra rab thams cad rdul phra rab @218b gcig gi nang du zhugs pas sa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i bsags pa'i mtshan nyid can med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rdul phra rab thams cad rdul phra rab @218b gcig gi nang du zhugs pas sa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i bsags pa'i mtshan nyid can med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because all atoms would enter into one atom, the characteristics of the accumulation of the earth mandala and so on would not exist.

original: de'i phyir rdul phra rab yod pa'i phyogs kyang khas blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rdul phra rab yod pa'i phyogs kyang khas blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not accept the position that atoms exist.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that reason,

original: drug gis cig car sbyar bas na //
analyzed: drug gis cig car sbyar bas na //
translated: If six were to join simultaneously,

original: phra rab rdul cha drug tu 'gyur //
analyzed: phra rab rdul cha drug tu 'gyur //
translated: the atom would have six parts.

original: drug po dag ni go gcig na //
analyzed: drug po dag ni go gcig na //
translated: If the six were in one place,

original: gong bu'ang rdul phran tsam du 'gyur //🔽zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gong bu'ang rdul phran tsam du 'gyur //🔽zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: the mass would be the size of an atom.

original: de ltar phyi'i don gcig dang du ma dang bral ba nyid du sun phyung ba ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa la yang de dang 'dra bar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar phyi'i don gcig dang du ma dang bral ba nyid du sun phyung ba ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa la yang de dang 'dra bar blta bar bya ste /
translated: Just as external objects are refuted as being neither one nor many, so consciousness should be regarded in the same way.

original: gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa la yang phyogs kyi cha shas kyi dbye ba yod do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa la yang phyogs kyi cha shas kyi dbye ba yod do //
translated: Because consciousness also has divisions of directional parts.

original: de bas na sngon po la sogs pa sun dbyung ba gang yin pa de dag nyid blo la yang khyad par med pa nyid de /
analyzed: de bas na sngon po la sogs pa sun dbyung ba gang yin pa de dag nyid blo la yang khyad par med pa nyid de /
translated: Therefore, the refutation of blue and so on is the same for the mind.

original: gzugs can yin pa'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa ni gcig dang du ma dang bral ba yin pa de shes pa la yang mnyam mo //
analyzed: gzugs can yin pa'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa ni gcig dang du ma dang bral ba yin pa de shes pa la yang mnyam mo //
translated: Because it has form, blue and so on are devoid of being one or many, and that is the same for consciousness.

original: de yang khong du ma chud pa las ldog par brtags pa'i ngo bor rnam par 'jog pa na phyogs kyi cha dang ldan pa nyid du rnam par 'jog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang khong du ma chud pa las ldog par brtags pa'i ngo bor rnam par 'jog pa na phyogs kyi cha dang ldan pa nyid du rnam par 'jog par 'gyur te /
translated: When that is posited as the nature of an object that is imagined to be the opposite of what is not understood, it is posited as having directional parts.

original: gzugs zhes bya bar gzugs yod pa ma yin no zhes ji skad bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya bar gzugs yod pa ma yin no zhes ji skad bshad pa yin te /
translated: As it was said, “Form does not exist as form.”

original: gzugs ni chu dang zheng dang phyogs dang ldan pa yin la 'di ni rnam par shes pa la yang khyad par med par yod na kun rdzob tu yod par thal bar ji ltar mnyam par 'gyur ba ma yin /
analyzed: gzugs ni chu dang zheng dang phyogs dang ldan pa yin la 'di ni rnam par shes pa la yang khyad par med par yod na kun rdzob tu yod par thal bar ji ltar mnyam par 'gyur ba ma yin /
translated: Form is endowed with length, breadth, and sides. If this were to exist without distinction in consciousness, how could it not be equally the case that it exists superficially?

original: de bas na de yang dngos po med pa nyid du gyur pa ma yin no //🔽de yang / dngos po med la rnam shes med //
analyzed: de bas na de yang dngos po med pa nyid du gyur pa ma yin no // de yang / dngos po med la rnam shes med //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that it does not exist at all.🔽And this is stated in the Descent into Laṅkā Sutra:🔽Consciousness does not exist for the nonexistent.

original: gzhi med kun gzhi'ang yod ma yin //🔽'di dag rtog ge ngan pa ni //
analyzed: gzhi med kun gzhi'ang yod ma yin // 'di dag rtog ge ngan pa ni //
translated: The foundation consciousness does not exist without a basis.🔽These are the speculations

original: ror gyur pa yis rnam par brtags //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das kyis lang kar gshegs pa las ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ror gyur pa yis rnam par brtags // zhes bya ba la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das kyis lang kar gshegs pa las ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: of those whose minds are polluted by bad doctrines.

original: de bas dngos po thams cad ni rang bzhin med pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de bas dngos po thams cad ni rang bzhin med pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus, the Lord has stated that all things are essenceless.🔽And here:

original: yang 'dir / bdag dang gzhan smras dngos 'di dag / yang dag du na gcig pa dang // du ma'i rang bzhin bral ba'i phyir //
analyzed: yang 'dir / bdag dang gzhan smras dngos 'di dag / yang dag du na gcig pa dang // du ma'i rang bzhin bral ba'i phyir //
translated: These things, whether spoken of by ourselves or others,

original: rang bzhin med de gzugs brnyan bzhin //
analyzed: rang bzhin med de gzugs brnyan bzhin //
translated: are essenceless, like a refl ection,🔽because, in reality, they are devoid of the nature of being🔽one or many.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: As such, all things are taught to be unreal.

original: de ltar dngos po thams cad dngos po med par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar dngos po thams cad dngos po med par bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught that all things are unreal,

original: da ni @219a * //
analyzed: da ni @219a * //
translated: now,

original: grub pa'i don nyid kyi mjug bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: grub pa'i don nyid kyi mjug bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to summarize the very point that has been established,

original: de bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said, “Therefore, etc.”

original: bshad ma thag pa'i rig pa'i tshul des na 'dzin pa po la sogs pa dang bral ba yin pas rgyu ba de 'gro ba rnams dang / mi rgyu ba de sems med pa ma lus shing lus pa mad pa'i dngos po rnams ni rang rgyud kyang yin la /🔽gzugs la sogs par brtags pa yin zhing rang rgyud kyi rnam pa can gyi ngo bo nyid gang la yod pa'i dngos po de ni /
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i rig pa'i tshul des na 'dzin pa po la sogs pa dang bral ba yin pas rgyu ba de 'gro ba rnams dang / mi rgyu ba de sems med pa ma lus shing lus pa mad pa'i dngos po rnams ni rang rgyud kyang yin la / gzugs la sogs par brtags pa yin zhing rang rgyud kyi rnam pa can gyi ngo bo nyid gang la yod pa'i dngos po de ni /
translated: Since the apprehender and so on are free from the just-explained mode of reasoning, the moving and the unmoving, all things without exception and remainder are one’s continuum.🔽The entities that are imputed as forms and so on and that possess the aspect of one’s continuum are

original: rang rgyud gzugs sogs brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid //🔽ces bya ste /
analyzed: rang rgyud gzugs sogs brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid //🔽ces bya ste /
translated: the entities that are the nature imputed as forms and so on.

original: rang gi rgyud nyid kyang gzugs la sogs par brtags pa ni phyi rol gyi don med du zin kyang rang gi bag chags tsam las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud nyid kyang gzugs la sogs par brtags pa ni phyi rol gyi don med du zin kyang rang gi bag chags tsam las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, the continuum itself is investigated as form, etc., because it arises from its own habitual tendencies, even though external objects do not exist.

original: yang na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis phan tshun phan 'dogs par mi byed pa de ni rang rgyud ces bya'o //
analyzed: yang na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis phan tshun phan 'dogs par mi byed pa de ni rang rgyud ces bya'o //
translated: Or else, the non-reciprocal assistance of the two, the apprehended object and the apprehending subject, is called the continuum.

original: de ltar na gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa 'di ji ltar blta bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa 'di ji ltar blta bar bya zhe na /
translated: Thus, how should this presentation of form, etc., be viewed?

original: brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “as the imagined nature.”

original: brtags pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid de rang bzhin 'di la yod pas na brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid de gzugs la sogs pa 'di dag thams cad ni brtags pa'i rang bzhin can no zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' yin pas don dam par gang zhig gang
analyzed: brtags pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid de rang bzhin 'di la yod pas na brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid de gzugs la sogs pa 'di dag thams cad ni brtags pa'i rang bzhin can no zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' yin pas don dam par gang zhig gang
translated: Since this nature exists in the imagined itself, it is the imagined nature. All of these, form, etc., are said to have the imagined nature. This is the philosophical position.

original: las tha dad par rnam par 'jog par mi nus so //
analyzed: las tha dad par rnam par 'jog par mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, ultimately, nothing can be established as different from anything else.

original: de yang khams gsum po 'di dag ma lus pa thams cad sgyu ma lta bu yin no zhes bya ba la sogs ji skad gsungs pa lta bu dang / yang rtog pa dag par bya ba'i phyir 'bad par bya ba'o zhes gsungs pa dang / dpal bde mchog gi rgyud phyi ma las kyang /🔽rtog pa rnams ni yongs dag phyir //
analyzed: de yang khams gsum po 'di dag ma lus pa thams cad sgyu ma lta bu yin no zhes bya ba la sogs ji skad gsungs pa lta bu dang / yang rtog pa dag par bya ba'i phyir 'bad par bya ba'o zhes gsungs pa dang / dpal bde mchog gi rgyud phyi ma las kyang / rtog pa rnams ni yongs dag phyir //
translated: And in the glorious Shriparamådya-tantra:🔽Because thoughts are completely pure,

original: des na rtog par yang dag bshad //
analyzed: des na rtog par yang dag bshad //
translated: They are explained as thoughts.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: And so forth.

original: de lta mod kyi phyi rol gyi don la mngon par chags ba'i rtog pa'i 'khrul pa nyid kyi 'khor ba dang rjes su mthun pa yin pa'i phyir tha mal pa zhes bya bar bshad la /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi phyi rol gyi don la mngon par chags ba'i rtog pa'i 'khrul pa nyid kyi 'khor ba dang rjes su mthun pa yin pa'i phyir tha mal pa zhes bya bar bshad la /
translated: However, since the error of attachment to external objects is samsara, it is explained as “ordinary.”

original: de ni thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyi phyi rol du mngon par zhen pa nyid las nges par bzlog ste /
analyzed: de ni thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyi phyi rol du mngon par zhen pa nyid las nges par bzlog ste /
translated: For those who desire liberation, it is to be turned away from attachment to external objects.

original: rang rang gi ngo bo nyid la nges par gzhag pa yang yin la /
analyzed: rang rang gi ngo bo nyid la nges par gzhag pa yang yin la /
translated: It is also to be established in its own nature.

original: rang gi ngo bo tsam la gzhag pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni 'bras bu kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid yin pas dag pa zhes bya @219b ba'i ming 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo tsam la gzhag pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni 'bras bu kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid yin pas dag pa zhes bya @219b ba'i ming 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: The conceptual thought that posits mere entityness obtains the name pure because it is the result of the absence of any negative consequences.

original: rang gi ngo bo cas la gnas //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo cas la gnas //
translated: The conception that posits mere intrinsic reality is the result of nontransgression and thus obtains the name pure.

original: blo yi dga' ston chen po yin //
analyzed: blo yi dga' ston chen po yin //
translated: It is the great feast of the mind.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad gsungs pa lta bu dang / 'di dag thams cad ni rnam par rtog pa tsam la rag las shing de'i rang bzhin yin pas sdug bsngal bar mtshan nyid gcig pa dang ; skad cig ma gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i bdag nyid can ni srid pa'i nye bar 'ching ba yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad gsungs pa lta bu dang / 'di dag thams cad ni rnam par rtog pa tsam la rag las shing de'i rang bzhin yin pas sdug bsngal bar mtshan nyid gcig pa dang ; skad cig ma gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i bdag nyid can ni srid pa'i nye bar 'ching ba yin la /
translated: Since all these are dependent on mere conception and are of its nature, they are of the same nature as suffering and are the bondage of existence that is the nature of a continuum of moments.

original: de rnam par ldog pa tsam ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji ltar bshad pa der yang kha phyi rol du bltas pa'i rnam par rtog pa las nges par bzlog par bya ba la 'bad par bya'o zhes nges par ston🔽pa yin te /
analyzed: de rnam par ldog pa tsam ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji ltar bshad pa der yang kha phyi rol du bltas pa'i rnam par rtog pa las nges par bzlog par bya ba la 'bad par bya'o zhes nges par ston pa yin te /
translated: Thus, it is taught that one should strive to turn away from conceptual thoughts that look outward.🔽It is taught that conceptual thought has no fault other than the adherence to external reality.

original: rnam par rtog pa la ni phyi rol du mngon par zhen pa las ma gtogs pa'i nyes pa dang bcas pa gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no zhes de las rnam par ldog pa ni phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi rgyu yin te rnam par rtog pa
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la ni phyi rol du mngon par zhen pa las ma gtogs pa'i nyes pa dang bcas pa gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no zhes de las rnam par ldog pa ni phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi rgyu yin te rnam par rtog pa
translated: Therefore, turning away from that is the cause of all excellence because conceptual thought is

original: khyad par can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: distinguished.

original: gal te de ltar na 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das par rnam par gzhag pa 'di dag thams cad brtags pa tsam gyi ngo bo nyid yin pa des na med par bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs kyi dper sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das par rnam par gzhag pa 'di dag thams cad brtags pa tsam gyi ngo bo nyid yin pa des na med par bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs kyi dper sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: If that is so, then all of these presentations of cyclic existence and nirvana are essentially just imputations. Therefore, they should be taken as examples of arguments that prove nonexistence.

original: de ni de lta bu'i dngos po 'di ni dri za'i grong khyer dag dang mtshungs shing 'dra ba yin pa ste /
analyzed: de ni de lta bu'i dngos po 'di ni dri za'i grong khyer dag dang mtshungs shing 'dra ba yin pa ste /
translated: That is, this sort of thing is similar to and like a city of gandharvas.

original: ji ltar na chu bo dang ri nye bar gyur pa las phyi'i dri za'i grong khyer med du zin kyang /
analyzed: ji ltar na chu bo dang ri nye bar gyur pa las phyi'i dri za'i grong khyer med du zin kyang /
translated: Just as, in the vicinity of a river or mountain, a city of gandharvas does not exist,

original: khang pa dkar po dang / rta dang glang po che dang / mi la sogs pa 'dra bar skyes bu la so sor snang bar skye'o //
analyzed: khang pa dkar po dang / rta dang glang po che dang / mi la sogs pa 'dra bar skyes bu la so sor snang bar skye'o //
translated: but appears to a person as if it were a white house, or a horse, or an elephant, or a man, and so on.

original: de bzhin du 'dzin pa po la sogs pa'i ngo bor med du zin kyang thog ma med pa'i dus kyi bag chags las byung ba 'dzin pa po la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dzin pa po la sogs pa'i ngo bor med du zin kyang thog ma med pa'i dus kyi bag chags las byung ba 'dzin pa po la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, even though the apprehender and so on do not exist, the appearance of the apprehender and so on arises, due to beginningless habitual tendencies.

original: yang na dri za'i grong khyer zhes bya ba la log pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par 'jig rten du grags pas dpe de nyid du nye bar sbyar ba yin te /
analyzed: yang na dri za'i grong khyer zhes bya ba la log pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par 'jig rten du grags pas dpe de nyid du nye bar sbyar ba yin te /
translated: Or, since a city of gandharvas is known in the world to be a false entity, it is used as an analogy.

original: dper na dri za'i grong khyer ni med kyang snang ba yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na dri za'i grong khyer ni med kyang snang ba yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as a city of gandharvas appears even though it does not exist,

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa yang de dang 'dra bar mtshungs par lta ba yin no zhes dri za'i grong khyer dang 'dra ba'i dpes bstan to //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa yang de dang 'dra bar mtshungs par lta ba yin no zhes dri za'i grong khyer dang 'dra ba'i dpes bstan to //
translated: Samsara and nirvana are also seen as being the same in this way.

original: des khyad par bstan pa'i phyir /🔽rgyu dang mi rgyu'i dngos po ma lus pa //
analyzed: des khyad par bstan pa'i phyir / rgyu dang mi rgyu'i dngos po ma lus pa //
translated: In order to demonstrate the distinction,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa @220a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa @220a * //
translated: he says, “all things, moving and unmoving,” and so on.

original: yin te / rgyu ba ni mi la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yin te / rgyu ba ni mi la sogs pa'o //
translated: Moving refers to humans and so on.

original: mi rgyu ba ni ri la sogs pa ste rgyu dang mi rgyu ba dang bcas par gnas pa'i dngos po'i tshogs ni rgyu dang mi rgyu ba'i dngos po ma lus pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi rgyu ba ni ri la sogs pa ste rgyu dang mi rgyu ba dang bcas par gnas pa'i dngos po'i tshogs ni rgyu dang mi rgyu ba'i dngos po ma lus pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Unmoving refers to mountains and so on. The collection of things that exist together with the moving and unmoving is called “all things, moving and unmoving.”

original: de bas na phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can gyi dngos po 'di rnams ni nges par brtags na de kho na nyid du yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: de bas na phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can gyi dngos po 'di rnams ni nges par brtags na de kho na nyid du yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Therefore, these things that have the nature of being internal and external are definitely not existent in reality when examined.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: phyi dang nang du snang ba sna tshogs 'di //
analyzed: phyi dang nang du snang ba sna tshogs 'di //
translated: These various appearances, internal and external,

original: yang dag nyid du ci yang nges pa med //
analyzed: yang dag nyid du ci yang nges pa med //
translated: are not ascertained as anything in reality.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is what is explained.

original: de yang ma brtags na nyams dga' ba nyid du 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir kun rdzob kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de yang ma brtags na nyams dga' ba nyid du 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir kun rdzob kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: Moreover, it is the nature of the superficial because it is desired to be delightful when not examined.

original: ma brtags na ni nyams dga' ba'i //
analyzed: ma brtags na ni nyams dga' ba'i //
translated: When not examined, it is delightful.

original: skye dang 'gag pa'i chos can rnams //
analyzed: skye dang 'gag pa'i chos can rnams //
translated: Things having the attributes of arising and ceasing,

original: don gyi bya ba byed nus pa'i //
analyzed: don gyi bya ba byed nus pa'i //
translated: having the nature of being able to perform the function of an object,

original: rang bzhin kun rdzob yin par bshad //
analyzed: rang bzhin kun rdzob yin par bshad //
translated: are explained as the superficial nature.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: This is what is stated.

original: de bas na sngar bshad ba'i lha'i sku la sogs pa rang gi sngags su bzhugs pa la 'gal ba med do zhes nye bar bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na sngar bshad ba'i lha'i sku la sogs pa rang gi sngags su bzhugs pa la 'gal ba med do zhes nye bar bsdu ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is a summary that there is no contradiction in the previously explained divine body, etc. existing in one's mantra.

original: de yang gzung ba la sogs pa med par bstan pas rang gi sems nyid la rang gi sems gzhug pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang gzung ba la sogs pa med par bstan pas rang gi sems nyid la rang gi sems gzhug pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is the mind itself entering into the mind itself, because it is taught that there is no apprehended object, etc.

original: me ni me la gzhug pa dang 'dra zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bur blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: me ni me la gzhug pa dang 'dra zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bur blta bar bya'o //
translated: It should be viewed as being like the example of fire entering into fire, etc.

original: gal te ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis 'dzin pa po la sogs pa med pas dngos po thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid yin na de lta na ni 'khor ba 'di yod pa ji ltar 'thad /
analyzed: gal te ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis 'dzin pa po la sogs pa med pas dngos po thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid yin na de lta na ni 'khor ba 'di yod pa ji ltar 'thad /
translated: If, in the manner explained, there is no grasper, etc., and all things are essenceless, then how could this cyclic existence be tenable?

original: de las thar pa ni ji ltar 'thad par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de las thar pa ni ji ltar 'thad par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: And how could liberation from it be tenable?

original: de'i phyir bdag dang bdag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag dang bdag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says “the conception of ‘I’ and ‘mine,’ etc.”

original: bdag dang bdag gi bde gnyis kyi rnam par rtog pa ni bdag dang bdag gir rnam rtog ces bya ste /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi bde gnyis kyi rnam par rtog pa ni bdag dang bdag gir rnam rtog ces bya ste /
translated: The conception of “I” and “mine” is the conception of “I” and “mine.”

original: bdag la sogs pa med par de la mngon par zhe na //
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa med par de la mngon par zhe na //
translated: Without “I” and so on, how could there be attachment to them?

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de'i rgyun ni rgyun gyis 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyun ni rgyun gyis 'jug pa'o //
translated: Its continuum is its continuous engagement.

original: de'i ngo bo dag gis zhes bya ba de rang bzhin gyis ni 'khor ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo dag gis zhes bya ba de rang bzhin gyis ni 'khor ba yin te /
translated: Its nature is its essence.

original: der ni zhes pa 'di ltar gnas pa na dri za'i grong khyer dang 'dra ba yin yang dngos po rnams la log par rtogs pa'i dbang gis 'khor ba na 'khor ba ste /
analyzed: der ni zhes pa 'di ltar gnas pa na dri za'i grong khyer dang 'dra ba yin yang dngos po rnams la log par rtogs pa'i dbang gis 'khor ba na 'khor ba ste /
translated: Here, in this way, while abiding, it is like a gandharva city, but due to the power of distorted conception, one cycles in samsara.

original: 'di dang gzhan du bde 'gro la sogs pa skye ba'i 'khor ba med bzhin du yang byis pa rnams la de ltar snang ba yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: 'di dang gzhan du bde 'gro la sogs pa skye ba'i 'khor ba med bzhin du yang byis pa rnams la de ltar snang ba yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Even though there is no samsara of birth in this life or the next, such as in the happy realms, it appears to the childish as if there is.

original: dag @220b pa'ang bdag dang bdag gir rtog pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rgyun de'i phyin ci log med pa de'i rang gi ngo bo nyid tsam des rnam par shes par bya zhing khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: dag @220b pa'ang bdag dang bdag gir rtog pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rgyun de'i phyin ci log med pa de'i rang gi ngo bo nyid tsam des rnam par shes par bya zhing khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: Also, the continuum of the conception of self and entities as self and entities is to be understood and realized by the mere intrinsic reality of that nonerroneous state.

original: de yang gang gi tshe de kho na nyid du gzung ba la sogs pa las rnam par dben pa'i sems la bdag la sogs par sgro btags pa de'i tshe 'khor ba yin la /
analyzed: de yang gang gi tshe de kho na nyid du gzung ba la sogs pa las rnam par dben pa'i sems la bdag la sogs par sgro btags pa de'i tshe 'khor ba yin la /
translated: Moreover, when the mind, which is devoid of apprehended objects and so on in reality, is reified as the self and so on, that is samsara.

original: gang gi tshe yang bdag la sogs par sgro btags pa dang bral ba'i rang gi ngo bo'i de nyid mthar thug pa de'i tshe ni sems kyi rgyal po de rnam par dag pa yin te bdag dang bdag gir log par rtogs pa las ldog pa nyid ni dag
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang bdag la sogs par sgro btags pa dang bral ba'i rang gi ngo bo'i de nyid mthar thug pa de'i tshe ni sems kyi rgyal po de rnam par dag pa yin te bdag dang bdag gir log par rtogs pa las ldog pa nyid ni dag
translated: When the ultimate reality of the mind is free from the superimposition of self and so on, then the king of mind is purified, and it should be understood that the cessation of the misconception of I and mine is the holy

original: pa ste / thar pa zhes bya ba yin par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: pa ste / thar pa zhes bya ba yin par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: state of liberation.

original: yang 'dir ji ltar /
analyzed: yang 'dir ji ltar /
translated: Moreover, here,

original: snang ba'i dngos po rnams la zhi ba dang // srid pa'i ngo bo nyid dag chos nyid kyis //
analyzed: snang ba'i dngos po rnams la zhi ba dang // srid pa'i ngo bo nyid dag chos nyid kyis //
translated: The nature of peace and existence is the same.

original: zhes pas stong pa nyid du ni gang gis 'khor ba rnam par spangs nas mya ngan las 'das pa tshol bar byed pa'i dbye ba ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te gnyis ka yang stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pas stong pa nyid du ni gang gis 'khor ba rnam par spangs nas mya ngan las 'das pa tshol bar byed pa'i dbye ba ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te gnyis ka yang stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By this, one should understand that there is no difference whatsoever between cyclic existence and nirvana, since both are empty.

original: de nyid kyis na slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyang /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyang /
translated: For this very reason, the master Nagarjuna said:

original: yang dag ma mthong 'jig rten dang // mya ngan 'das par rlom pa ste //
analyzed: yang dag ma mthong 'jig rten dang // mya ngan 'das par rlom pa ste //
translated: The world is imagined to be🔽nirvana, but the real is not seen.🔽The world is imagined to be

original: yang dag mthong ba 'jig rten dang // mya ngan 'das par rlom sems med //
analyzed: yang dag mthong ba 'jig rten dang // mya ngan 'das par rlom sems med //
translated: nirvana, but the real is not seen.

original: srid pa dang ni mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: srid pa dang ni mya ngan 'das //
translated: Samsara and nirvana

original: 'di gnyis yod pa ma yin te //
analyzed: 'di gnyis yod pa ma yin te //
translated: are not even dual.

original: srid pa yongs su shes pa ni //
analyzed: srid pa yongs su shes pa ni //
translated: The thorough knowledge of samsara

original: mya ngan 'das zhes brjod pa yin //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das zhes brjod pa yin //
translated: is called nirvana.

original: zhes bshad pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang rab 'byor so so'i skye bo'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni de bzhin nyid du gcig pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad du gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bshad pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang rab 'byor so so'i skye bo'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni de bzhin nyid du gcig pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad du gsungs pa ste /
translated: And the Lord has said, “Subhuti, the suchness of the common man, the suchness of the holy person, the suchness of the Buddha, these suchnesses are not two or divided.”

original: de bas na kun rdzob tu phan tshun dbye ba yod du zin kyang /
