analyzed: de bas na kun rdzob tu phan tshun dbye ba yod du zin kyang /
translated: Therefore, although there is mutual distinction on the covering level,

original: de kho na nyid du ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: there is not on the level of ultimate reality.

original: ci'i phyir chos nyid kyis dbye ba med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir chos nyid kyis dbye ba med pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is there no distinction by way of ultimate reality?

original: gang gi phyir gzung ba la sogs zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzung ba la sogs zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because of being free from the nature of subject and so on,

original: gtan tshigs gang gi phyir gzung ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral zhing med pa yin par thams cad du ste /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gang gi phyir gzung ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral zhing med pa yin par thams cad du ste /
translated: the reason is that it is free from, or does not exist as, the nature of subject and so on.

original: zhi ba dang srid pa kun la rtag tu ste dus thams cad du grub pa yin te /
analyzed: zhi ba dang srid pa kun la rtag tu ste dus thams cad du grub pa yin te /
translated: It is always, at all times, established in all of existence and peace.🔽As the Transcendent Conqueror said in the

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis lang kar gshegs pa @221a * //
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis lang kar gshegs pa @221a * //
translated: Sutra on Entering Lanka:

original: las ; de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'jig rten du byung yang rung /
analyzed: las ; de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'jig rten du byung yang rung /
translated: Whether Tathagatas appear in the world

original: 'jig rten du ma byung yang rung /
analyzed: 'jig rten du ma byung yang rung /
translated: or not,🔽the reality of phenomena, the expanse of reality, and the changelessness of phenomena

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos mi 'gyur ba nyid ni ye nas gnas pa nyid do zhes bya ba ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos mi 'gyur ba nyid ni ye nas gnas pa nyid do zhes bya ba ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: have always been present.

original: de ru snang ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i dngos po de ru so sor snang ba de'i rang bzhin yang yin zhing kun du rtog pa yang yin pas de ru snang ba'i rang bzhin kun du rtog ste /
analyzed: de ru snang ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i dngos po de ru so sor snang ba de'i rang bzhin yang yin zhing kun du rtog pa yang yin pas de ru snang ba'i rang bzhin kun du rtog ste /
translated: The nature of the things that appear there is also imagination, because it is the nature of the things that appear there as individual things that are moving or unmoving.

original: de las gzhan pa'i rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba thams cad ci yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba thams cad ci yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Nothing else exists, nothing moving or unmoving.

original: log pa'i rnam par rtog pa de nyid gcig pur zad kyi de las gzhan pa'i rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i phyi'i dngos po mtha' yas pa ci yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: log pa'i rnam par rtog pa de nyid gcig pur zad kyi de las gzhan pa'i rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i phyi'i dngos po mtha' yas pa ci yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The point is that only that false imagination exists, and nothing else exists, no external things, moving or unmoving.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las /
translated: Thus, the Madhyāntavibhāga says:

original: yang dag ma yin kun rtog yod //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin kun rtog yod //
translated: False imagination exists.

original: de la gnyis po yod ma yin //
analyzed: de la gnyis po yod ma yin //
translated: Duality does not exist there.

original: stong pa nyid ni de la yod //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni de la yod //
translated: Emptiness exists there.

original: de la yang ni de yod do //🔽zhes bshad pa yin pas /
analyzed: de la yang ni de yod do //🔽zhes bshad pa yin pas /
translated: And that exists in it.

original: sems las gzhan pa'i nga rgyal gyi yul bdag la sogs pa 'ga' yang yod par gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sems las gzhan pa'i nga rgyal gyi yul bdag la sogs pa 'ga' yang yod par gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no self or anything else that is the object of pride, apart from the mind.

original: gtan tshigs de'i phyir sems de nyid nga rgyal gyi yul yin gyi /
analyzed: gtan tshigs de'i phyir sems de nyid nga rgyal gyi yul yin gyi /
translated: For that reason, the mind itself is the object of pride.

original: bdag la sogs pa ci yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa ci yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no self or anything else at all.

original: de ni zhi ba dang srid pa gnyis kyi rang bzhin bye brag med pa nye bar bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni zhi ba dang srid pa gnyis kyi rang bzhin bye brag med pa nye bar bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to include the absence of distinction between the nature of peace and existence,

original: rang bzhin gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “Whatever is the nature of the conventional,” and so on.🔽Whatever is the nature of the conventional, which is known individually by the childish, that nature of the conventional known by the childish is the nature of the ultimate known by the noble ones.

original: byis pa rnams kyis so sor shes par gyur pa'i kun rdzob kyi rang bzhin gang zhig yin pa'i kun rdzob tu byis pas shes pa de'i rang gi ngo bo don dam pa'i rang bzhin 'phags pas mkhyen pa de nyid ni rang nyid kyi ngo bo zhig yin te
analyzed: byis pa rnams kyis so sor shes par gyur pa'i kun rdzob kyi rang bzhin gang zhig yin pa'i kun rdzob tu byis pas shes pa de'i rang gi ngo bo don dam pa'i rang bzhin 'phags pas mkhyen pa de nyid ni rang nyid kyi ngo bo zhig yin te
translated: That is its own nature,

original: / gang gi phyir kun rdzob kyi rang bzhin rig pa dang lung gi dbye bas rnam par dpyad na /
analyzed: / gang gi phyir kun rdzob kyi rang bzhin rig pa dang lung gi dbye bas rnam par dpyad na /
translated: because when the nature of the conventional is analyzed by the divisions of reasoning and scripture,

original: ngo bo nyid med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: de bas na zhes pa de'i phyir de dag thams cad bye brag med pa'i blos dngos po thams cad dbye ba med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de bas na zhes pa de'i phyir de dag thams cad bye brag med pa'i blos dngos po thams cad dbye ba med pa nyid yin te /
translated: Therefore, for that reason, all of them are undifferentiated by the mind, all things are undifferentiated.

original: zhi ba dang srid pa'i rang bzhin can gyi dngos po thams cad ni dbye ba med cing stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: zhi ba dang srid pa'i rang bzhin can gyi dngos po thams cad ni dbye ba med cing stong pa nyid de /
translated: All things that have the nature of peace and existence are undifferentiated and empty.

original: de'i blo ni rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i blo ni rtogs pa ste /
translated: The mind of that is realization.

original: de'i rgyur gyur pas dbye ba med cing tha dang du bya ba med pas zhi ba dang srid pa'i rang bzhin can gyi dngos @221b po thams cad dbye ba med cing ngo bo nyid gcig pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i rgyur gyur pas dbye ba med cing tha dang du bya ba med pas zhi ba dang srid pa'i rang bzhin can gyi dngos @221b po thams cad dbye ba med cing ngo bo nyid gcig pa kho na yin no //
translated: Because it is the cause of that, it is undifferentiated and not to be differentiated. Therefore, all things that have the nature of peace and existence are undifferentiated and have one nature.

original: de yang 'dir /🔽dngos gcig dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin te //
analyzed: de yang 'dir / dngos gcig dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin te //
translated: And that is explained here:🔽One thing is the nature of all things.

original: dngos gcig dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin yin //
analyzed: dngos gcig dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin yin //
translated: One thing is the nature of all things.

original: dngos po gcig gi de nyid gang gis mthong //
analyzed: dngos po gcig gi de nyid gang gis mthong //
translated: Whoever sees the thatness of one thing

original: de yis dngos po kun gyi de nyid mthong //🔽zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de yis dngos po kun gyi de nyid mthong // zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Sees the thatness of all things.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis kyang /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis kyang /
translated: And for that very reason, the noble Nagarjuna also said:

original: kun rdzob dag ni ma gtogs par //
analyzed: kun rdzob dag ni ma gtogs par //
translated: Apart from the conventional,

original: de nyid kyang ni dmigs mi 'gyur //🔽kun rdzob stong pa nyid du bshad //
analyzed: de nyid kyang ni dmigs mi 'gyur // kun rdzob stong pa nyid du bshad //
translated: reality itself is not perceived.🔽The conventional is explained as emptiness;

original: stong pa nyid ni kun rdzob yin //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni kun rdzob yin //
translated: emptiness is the conventional.

original: zhes bshad pa dang / de bzhin du brgyad stong pa las kyang /
analyzed: zhes bshad pa dang / de bzhin du brgyad stong pa las kyang /
translated: And likewise, the Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines says,

original: koo shi ka 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: koo shi ka 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Kauśika, it is like this:

original: 'dzam bu'i gling na shing tha dad pa dang / yal ga tha dad pa dang / lo ma tha dad pa dang / me tog tha dad pa dang / 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa tha dad par skyes pa de rnams kyi grib ma de ni bye brag med cing tha dad par mi mthong ste /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling na shing tha dad pa dang / yal ga tha dad pa dang / lo ma tha dad pa dang / me tog tha dad pa dang / 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa tha dad par skyes pa de rnams kyi grib ma de ni bye brag med cing tha dad par mi mthong ste /
translated: The trees in the Rose Apple Land have different trunks, different branches, different leaves, different flowers, and different fruits. The shadows of those trees are not seen to be different, and they are not distinguished.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: grib ma grib ma zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o //
analyzed: grib ma grib ma zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o //
translated: they are counted as shadows, shadows.

original: de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang stong pa nyid du ngo bo gcig par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang stong pa nyid du ngo bo gcig par blta bar bya ste /
translated: Likewise, all phenomena should be seen as having one nature in emptiness.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ngo zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ngo zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: they are the nature of emptiness, the nature of emptiness.

original: thams cad ci yang yod pa ma yin te //
analyzed: thams cad ci yang yod pa ma yin te //
translated: Nothing at all exists.🔽In response to this, the treatise states:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang bshad pa de'i phyir snang bar gyur pa'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang bshad pa de'i phyir snang bar gyur pa'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Appearances and the mind that conceives of them🔽are both absent in the absence of duality.

original: snang bar gyur pa ni so sor snang bar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: snang bar gyur pa ni so sor snang bar gyur pa ste /
translated: Appearances are what appear individually.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid gzung bar bya ba'i rang bzhin gyi yul rnams gang yin pa dang gang gzhan ci yang rung ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid gzung bar bya ba'i rang bzhin gyi yul rnams gang yin pa dang gang gzhan ci yang rung ba ste /
translated: They are the objects that are apprehended, which have the nature of form and so forth.

original: 'dzin pa po'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa ni rtog pa ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa po'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa ni rtog pa ste /
translated: The mind that conceives of them is the apprehending consciousness.

original: bdag tu shes pa de lta bu'i bdag nyid can du gyur pa'i gnas dang rten du gyur pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa de dang / de'i mtshan nyid dang bral zhing med par gyur pa yin pas med pa ni nye bar mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag tu shes pa de lta bu'i bdag nyid can du gyur pa'i gnas dang rten du gyur pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa de dang / de'i mtshan nyid dang bral zhing med par gyur pa yin pas med pa ni nye bar mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The absence of such a self-knowing mind and the absence of the objects and subjects that constitute its basis and support, which have the nature of such a self-knowing mind, is the non-observation of nonexistence.

original: de'i phyir dngos po rnams tha dad par gyur cing rnam par dbye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po rnams tha dad par gyur cing rnam par dbye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, entities are distinct and differentiated.

original: de ltar rnam par dpyad pa na nye bar dmigs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par dpyad pa na nye bar dmigs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Thus, when analyzed in this way, they are not observed.

original: de nas zhes pa bshad ma thag pa'i tshul gyis gzugs la sogs pa ni snang ba tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: de nas zhes pa bshad ma thag pa'i tshul gyis gzugs la sogs pa ni snang ba tsam du zad kyi /
translated: Next, in the manner just explained, form and so on are mere appearances.

original: phyi'i gzugs la sogs pa 'di dag thams cad ni ci yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi'i gzugs la sogs pa 'di dag thams cad ni ci yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: All these external forms and so on do not exist at all.

original: yang na thams cad med @222a * //
analyzed: yang na thams cad med @222a * //
translated: Or, “nothing exists at all.”

original: ces bya ba ni gang gi phyir bral ba'i med par gyur pa phan tshun ldog pa med pa nyid kyis rang bzhin gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni gang gi phyir bral ba'i med par gyur pa phan tshun ldog pa med pa nyid kyis rang bzhin gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the absence of separation, the absence of nonexistence, and the absence of mutual exclusion, they become a single nature.

original: de bas na chos nyid kyi dbye ba med pa nyid yin no zhes blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na chos nyid kyi dbye ba med pa nyid yin no zhes blta bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be seen that the differentiation of reality does not exist.🔽Moreover, it is as stated:

original: de yang / so so'i skye bo'i shes pa gang //
analyzed: de yang / so so'i skye bo'i shes pa gang //
translated: The consciousness of ordinary beings

original: rang bzhin gyis ni mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ni mya ngan 'das //
translated: is naturally nirvana.

original: de ni sangs rgyas sgrar bshad de //
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas sgrar bshad de //
translated: It is explained to be the sound of buddhahood,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rgyal ba bzhin //🔽zhes ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rgyal ba bzhin //🔽zhes ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: like the bodhisattva Jina.

original: de bas na de kho na nyid la ma ltos pa ni so so'i skye bo dang / bcom ldan 'das tha dad par rnam par gzhag gi de kho na nyid yid la byed pa'i sems pa ni dbye ba 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de kho na nyid la ma ltos pa ni so so'i skye bo dang / bcom ldan 'das tha dad par rnam par gzhag gi de kho na nyid yid la byed pa'i sems pa ni dbye ba 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, one who does not rely on reality is an ordinary person, and the Blessed One is posited as distinct. But the intention of taking reality to mind does not have any distinctions at all.

original: de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon chos kyi grags pa'i zhal snga nas kyis kyang /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon chos kyi grags pa'i zhal snga nas kyis kyang /
translated: For this very reason, the master Dharmakīrti also says:

original: mkhas pa rnams kyis gang bshad de //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyis gang bshad de //
translated: What is explained by the wise

original: 'di ni dngos po'i stobs kyis 'ongs //
analyzed: 'di ni dngos po'i stobs kyis 'ongs //
translated: comes from the power of things.

original: ji lta ji ltar rnam dpyad pa //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar rnam dpyad pa //
translated: The more one analyzes,

original: de lta de ltar rnam bden 'gyur //
analyzed: de lta de ltar rnam bden 'gyur //
translated: the more true aspects there are.

original: zhes ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is explained.

original: da ni dad dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par dag pa ston te dad pa'i stobs rnam par dag pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi stobs rnam par dag pa dang / de bzhin du dran pa'i stobs rnam par dag pa dang /
analyzed: da ni dad dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par dag pa ston te dad pa'i stobs rnam par dag pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi stobs rnam par dag pa dang / de bzhin du dran pa'i stobs rnam par dag pa dang /
translated: Now, beginning with “faith” and so on, he teaches the purity of the maṇḍala: the purity of the power of faith, the purity of the power of diligence, and likewise the purity of the power of mindfulness,

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs rnam par dag pa rnams ni rim bzhin du sgo bzang pos srung bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs rnam par dag pa rnams ni rim bzhin du sgo bzang pos srung bar byed pa ste /
translated: The purities of the powers of meditative concentration are, respectively, the protection by the good door.

original: gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'i sgo srung dang bcas pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rnam par brtags nas sngags dam pa'i thig le'i gzugs su rang gi yid rnam par bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'i sgo srung dang bcas pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rnam par brtags nas sngags dam pa'i thig le'i gzugs su rang gi yid rnam par bsgom par bya ste /
translated: Having imagined the mandala wheel with the door guardians such as Yamantaka, one should meditate on ones own mind in the form of the drop of the sacred mantra.

original: 'od dang ldan zhes 'og nas bshad pa dang sbyar ro ;
analyzed: 'od dang ldan zhes 'og nas bshad pa dang sbyar ro ;
translated: Endowed with light is to be supplied from below.

original: / shes rab rnam dag ma lus yul du snang //
analyzed: / shes rab rnam dag ma lus yul du snang //
translated: The object of the pure wisdom appears.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i lha mor gyur pa rnams ni yul gyi ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i lha mor gyur pa rnams ni yul gyi ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: The goddesses such as Rupavajra, etc., are the nature of the objects.

original: mtshan ma med pa ni mtshan ma thams cad spangs pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa ni mtshan ma thams cad spangs pa ste /
translated: Signlessness is the abandonment of all signs.

original: des dga' ba ni mchog tu dga' ba'i bde ba'o //
analyzed: des dga' ba ni mchog tu dga' ba'i bde ba'o //
translated: The joy is the bliss of supreme joy.

original: de nyid rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: That is the purity.

original: de ni ma lus pa'i lha mo spyan la sogs pa'i tshogs kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de ni ma lus pa'i lha mo spyan la sogs pa'i tshogs kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: That is the nature of the entire host of goddesses such as Locana, etc.

original: sems can ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po 'dzin pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: sems can ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po 'dzin pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Sentient beings are the nature of the sense faculties such as the eyes.

original: don ni gzugs la sogs pa gzung bar gyur pa yul gyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: don ni gzugs la sogs pa gzung bar gyur pa yul gyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Objects are the nature of the objects such as form that are to be apprehended.

original: bdag ni lan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba'o //
analyzed: bdag ni lan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba'o //
translated: The self is the view of the transitory collection that arises once.

original: rnam rtog ni gzung ba dang @222b 'dzin par kun du rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: rnam rtog ni gzung ba dang @222b 'dzin par kun du rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Conceptualization is the nature of the conception of the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam shes ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam shes ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'o //
translated: Engaging consciousness is the five collections of consciousness such as the eye consciousness.

original: de ltar na dbang po dang don dang bdag dang rnam par rtog pa dang 'jug pa'i rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar na dbang po dang don dang bdag dang rnam par rtog pa dang 'jug pa'i rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: Thus, the sense faculties, objects, the self, conceptualization, and engaging consciousness are the five conceptualizations.

original: de rnams kyi rnam par dag pa ni mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rnam par dag pa ni mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: Their purity is nonapprehension.

original: de yang rim pa bzhin du me long lta bu la sogs pa'i yid dri ma med pa'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: de yang rim pa bzhin du me long lta bu la sogs pa'i yid dri ma med pa'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rang bzhin yin te /
translated: That is the nature of the stainless mind, which is the nature of all buddhas such as Vairocana and so on.

original: me long ni me long lta bu'i ye shes so //
analyzed: me long ni me long lta bu'i ye shes so //
translated: The mirror is mirrorlike wisdom.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni mnyam nyid kyi ye shes dang / so sor rtog pa'i ye shes dang / bya ba grub pa'i ye shes dang / chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i ye shes rnams bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni mnyam nyid kyi ye shes dang / so sor rtog pa'i ye shes dang / bya ba grub pa'i ye shes dang / chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i ye shes rnams bsdu'o //
translated: The words “and so on” include the wisdom of equality, the wisdom of individual investigation, the wisdom of accomplishing activities, and the wisdom of the pure sphere of reality.

original: me long la sogs pa'i yid kyang yin la dri ma med par gyur pa yang yin pas na /
analyzed: me long la sogs pa'i yid kyang yin la dri ma med par gyur pa yang yin pas na /
translated: They are also the mental consciousnesses of mirror and so on, and they are also stainless.🔽Therefore,

original: me long sogs yid dri med do //
analyzed: me long sogs yid dri med do //
translated: They are the stainless mirror and so on.

original: de nyid kyi ngo bo nyid de //
analyzed: de nyid kyi ngo bo nyid de //
translated: They are the nature of that.

original: rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lor yang gyur pa gang yin pa de ni /🔽me long sogs yid dri med ngo bo bas //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lor yang gyur pa gang yin pa de ni / me long sogs yid dri med ngo bo bas //
translated: They are also the wheel of the natural maṇḍala.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore,🔽They are the stainless mirror and so on, the nature of that.

original: de'i rang bzhin ni de kho na nyid du na rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni de kho na nyid du na rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: Their nature is that, in reality, they are the nature of all buddhas, such as Vairocana, and so on.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni snga ma la ltos pa'i tshig gis bsdu ba ste ;
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni snga ma la ltos pa'i tshig gis bsdu ba ste ;
translated: The word “also” is a connective particle that refers to the previous [line].

original: don rnam par dag pa ni me long lta bu'i ye shes te /
analyzed: don rnam par dag pa ni me long lta bu'i ye shes te /
translated: The pure object is the mirror-like intuition.

original: de rnam par dag pa ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: de rnam par dag pa ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: Its purity is Vairocana.

original: sems can rnam par dag pa ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes te /
analyzed: sems can rnam par dag pa ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes te /
translated: The pure sentient being is the intuition of equality.

original: de rnam par dag pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
analyzed: de rnam par dag pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
translated: Its purity is Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: bdag rnam par dag pa ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes te de rnam par dag pa ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag rnam par dag pa ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes te de rnam par dag pa ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: The pure self is the intuition of individual conceptualization. Its purity is Amitābha.

original: rnam par rtog pa rnam par dag pa ni bya ba grub pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnam par dag pa ni bya ba grub pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The pure conceptualization is the intuition of successful activities.

original: de rnam par dag pa ni don yod grub pa'o //
analyzed: de rnam par dag pa ni don yod grub pa'o //
translated: Its purity is Amoghasiddhi.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnam par dag pa ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnam par dag pa ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The purity of the evolving consciousness is the purity of the realm of Dharma.

original: de rnam par dag pa ni mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: de rnam par dag pa ni mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: Its purity is Akṣhobhya.

original: thabs dang sa'i khams rnam par dag pa ni spyan no //
analyzed: thabs dang sa'i khams rnam par dag pa ni spyan no //
translated: The method and the earth element are pure as Locanā.

original: smon lam dang chu rnam par dag pa ni m'a ma k'i'o //
analyzed: smon lam dang chu rnam par dag pa ni m'a ma k'i'o //
translated: The vow and the water element are pure as Māmakī.

original: stobs dang me rnam par dag par ni gos dkar mo'o //
analyzed: stobs dang me rnam par dag par ni gos dkar mo'o //
translated: The power and the fire element are pure as Pāṇḍaravāsinī.

original: ye shes dang rlung rnam par dag pa ni sgrol ma'o //
analyzed: ye shes dang rlung rnam par dag pa ni sgrol ma'o //
translated: Wisdom and the pure energies are Tara.

original: dbang po'i tshogs ni sems can te 'dzin pa por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i tshogs ni sems can te 'dzin pa por gyur pa'o //
translated: The group of sense organs is sentient beings, the perceivers.

original: don ni yul drug ste /
analyzed: don ni yul drug ste /
translated: The objects are the six sense objects.

original: bzung bar gyur pa @223a * //
analyzed: bzung bar gyur pa @223a * //
translated: They are the perceived.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: They are form and so forth.

original: bdag tu rnam par rtog pa ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid de bdag go zhes blta ba'o //
analyzed: bdag tu rnam par rtog pa ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid de bdag go zhes blta ba'o //
translated: The conceptualizing is the afflicted mind, which views the self as the self.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste bag chags kyi gzhir gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste bag chags kyi gzhir gyur pa'o //
translated: The conceptualization is the ground of all, which is the basis of habitual tendencies.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni mig la sogs pa rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni mig la sogs pa rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The engaging consciousnesses are the five types such as the eye consciousness.

original: gzugs ni dbu ba lta bur bshad //
analyzed: gzugs ni dbu ba lta bur bshad //
translated: Form is explained to be like foam.

original: tshor ba chu yi chu bur 'dra //
analyzed: tshor ba chu yi chu bur 'dra //
translated: Feeling is like a water bubble.

original: 'du shes smig rgyu lta bu ste //
analyzed: 'du shes smig rgyu lta bu ste //
translated: Perception is like a mirage.

original: 'du byed rnams ni chu shing 'dra //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni chu shing 'dra //
translated: Formations are like a plantain tree.

original: rnam shes sgyu ma lta bu ste //
analyzed: rnam shes sgyu ma lta bu ste //
translated: Consciousness is like an illusion.

original: de ltar phung po bstan pa ni //
analyzed: de ltar phung po bstan pa ni //
translated: Thus the aggregates are taught.

original: rkang gnyis mchog gis thams cad du //
analyzed: rkang gnyis mchog gis thams cad du //
translated: The supreme among two-legged beings

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bshad //🔽ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bshad //🔽ces bya ba'o //
translated: taught this to the bodhisattvas.

original: snying rje'i tshul med stong pa nyid la zhe na //
analyzed: snying rje'i tshul med stong pa nyid la zhe na //
translated: But if one is attached to emptiness, which is not the way of compassion,

original: des ni lam gyi dam pa rnyed mi 'gyur //
analyzed: des ni lam gyi dam pa rnyed mi 'gyur //
translated: One will not find the supreme path.

original: gal te gnyis po gcig tu sbyor shes na //🔽srid dang mya ngan 'das la mi gnas so //
analyzed: gal te gnyis po gcig tu sbyor shes na // srid dang mya ngan 'das la mi gnas so //
translated: If one knows how to unite the two,

original: zhes bshad pas //
analyzed: zhes bshad pas //
translated: One will not abide in cyclic existence or in nirvana.

original: de bzhin nyid ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes te /
translated: Thusness is nondual wisdom.

original: de nyid rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: It is pure.

original: de'i sbyor ba bas 'khor lo'i gtso bo ste /
analyzed: de'i sbyor ba bas 'khor lo'i gtso bo ste /
translated: Its union is the chief of the wheels,

original: 'khor lo'i bdag po'i ngo bo nyid du sems 'di dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo lta bur gnas pa yin no //🔽gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba la gzugs kyi phur po la sogs pa la gang mi shes pa'i 'khrul pa de dang rnam par bral zhing spangs pa des na dri ma med pa yang yin la phung po la sogs pa yang yin pas na dri med phung
analyzed: 'khor lo'i bdag po'i ngo bo nyid du sems 'di dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo lta bur gnas pa yin no // gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba la gzugs kyi phur po la sogs pa la gang mi shes pa'i 'khrul pa de dang rnam par bral zhing spangs pa des na dri ma med pa yang yin la phung po la sogs pa yang yin pas na dri med phung
translated: and the mind is situated like the wheel mandala, in the nature of the lord of the wheel.🔽The stainless aggregates and so on are the aggregates of form and so on.

original: po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The stainless aggregates are those that are free from the error of ignorance, which is the nail of form and so on.

original: yang de rnams kyang yin la mig yor lta bur snang ba tsam du dngos po'i ngo bo yang yin pas de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: yang de rnams kyang yin la mig yor lta bur snang ba tsam du dngos po'i ngo bo yang yin pas de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Moreover, they are so called because they are just like optical illusions, in that they are the nature of entities that appear as mere representations.

original: yang na 'di rnams kyi dri ma med pa nyid ni phyir rol nyid du sgro btags pas nan gyis sgro btags pa nyid ni 'khrul pa yin la de nyid ni dri ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na 'di rnams kyi dri ma med pa nyid ni phyir rol nyid du sgro btags pas nan gyis sgro btags pa nyid ni 'khrul pa yin la de nyid ni dri ma yin te /
translated: Or else, their stainlessness is the superimposition of externality, and the superimposition of that is error, and that itself is a stain.

original: 'khrul pa ni dri ma'i ngo bo nyid yin pas 'khrul pa'i dri ma de dang bral ba yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'khrul pa ni dri ma'i ngo bo nyid yin pas 'khrul pa'i dri ma de dang bral ba yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Since error is the nature of a stain, it should be understood that they are free from the stain of error.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni skye mched la sogs pa gzung ste /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni skye mched la sogs pa gzung ste /
translated: The phrase “and so on” includes the sense bases and so on.

original: de rnams kyang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de rnams kyang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: They too are the nature of nonentities.

original: des grub pa ni rdzogs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: des grub pa ni rdzogs par gyur pa'o //
translated: Their establishment is their completion.

original: ser sna ni gtong bar mi byed pa'i sems nyid de de nyid thog mar byas pa gang yin pa de ni ser sna la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ser sna ni gtong bar mi byed pa'i sems nyid de de nyid thog mar byas pa gang yin pa de ni ser sna la sogs pa ste /
translated: Stinginess is the very state of mind that does not give. That which is made primary by that is stinginess and so on.

original: 'chal pa'i tshul khrims dang / bzod pa med pa dang / le lo dang sems g-yeng ba dang shes rab 'chal pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'chal pa'i tshul khrims dang / bzod pa med pa dang / le lo dang sems g-yeng ba dang shes rab 'chal pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The obscurations to the perfections are the faults of the perfections, such as immorality, impatience, laziness, distraction, and confused intelligence.

original: de rnams las @223b ldog par gyur pa ni med pa'o //🔽de'i rnam par dag pa ni gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid de pha rol tu phyin pa ste /🔽sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / sa rnams rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa rnams so //🔽de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / sa de rnams nyid ni dkar po'i chos yin la /🔽de'i rang bzhin ni ser sna la sogs pa las ldog par gyur pa'i rang bzhin no //

original: 'jug par dka' ba nyid kyi shes rab kyi bdag nyid can yin pa dang / gzhan gyi lung 'bogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa nyid kyis gzhan rnams kyi 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thams cad bskyed pa nyid kyis rgya che ba'i phyir thabs kyi bdag nyid can yin te snying rje'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'jug par dka' ba nyid kyi shes rab kyi bdag nyid can yin pa dang / gzhan gyi lung 'bogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa nyid kyis gzhan rnams kyi 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thams cad bskyed pa nyid kyis rgya che ba'i phyir thabs kyi bdag nyid can yin te snying rje'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: It is the nature of wisdom, which is difficult to enter, and it is the nature of method, which is vast because it generates all mundane and supramundane perfections of others through the cause of imparting the transmission to others.

original: da ni rnam par spros pa de'i mnyam pa nyid kyi bdag nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir dam pa'i don du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: da ni rnam par spros pa de'i mnyam pa nyid kyi bdag nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir dam pa'i don du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Now, in order to teach the nature of equality of that proliferation, he says, ultimately, etc.

original: don dam par ni chos nyid kyis na dngos po ci yang gzhan dag las dbye ba med pa yin zhing sna tshogs pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin la dbye ba med pa min te /
analyzed: don dam par ni chos nyid kyis na dngos po ci yang gzhan dag las dbye ba med pa yin zhing sna tshogs pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin la dbye ba med pa min te /
translated: Ultimately, by nature, nothing is differentiated from other things, and it is not of a variegated nature.🔽Nor is it undifferentiated.

original: rang bzhin gcig kyang mi 'dod do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig kyang mi 'dod do //
translated: Nor is a single nature asserted.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzhan du 'dzin pa las ni ldog phyir dang // zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gzhan du 'dzin pa las ni ldog phyir dang // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because of the reversal from the apprehension of otherness.

original: gzhan dag la gzhan du mngon par zhen pa las rnam par ldog par gyur cing med par gyur pas so //
analyzed: gzhan dag la gzhan du mngon par zhen pa las rnam par ldog par gyur cing med par gyur pas so //
translated: Because of the reversal from the apprehension of otherness, because of the non-existence of otherness.

original: gal te gzhan pa ro la 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na cig shos de las dbye ba med pa dang / dbye ba yod pa la sogs pa dpyad par bya ba dag yin na /🔽gzhan du 'dzin pa las ldog pa des na gzhan las byed pa med pa'am /
analyzed: gal te gzhan pa ro la 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na cig shos de las dbye ba med pa dang / dbye ba yod pa la sogs pa dpyad par bya ba dag yin na / gzhan du 'dzin pa las ldog pa des na gzhan las byed pa med pa'am /
translated: If otherness existed in any way, the other would be subject to analysis as to whether it is without distinction from that or with distinction.

original: dbye ba med pa ma yin pa cung zad kyang 'dod pa'i ma yin no //🔽ci'i @224a * //
analyzed: dbye ba med pa ma yin pa cung zad kyang 'dod pa'i ma yin no // ci'i @224a * //
translated: But because of the reversal from the apprehension of otherness, we do not accept that there is no otherness at all, or that there is no distinction.

original: phyir gzhan du 'dzin pa las rnam par ldog ce na /
analyzed: phyir gzhan du 'dzin pa las rnam par ldog ce na /
translated: Why is there a reversal from the apprehension of otherness?🔽Because of the absence of difference, etc.

original: de bzhin bye brag la sogs bral phyir ro //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de bzhin bye brag la sogs bral phyir ro // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because of the absence of difference, etc.

original: de bzhin te de'i rnam par dbye ba med pa dang / dbye ba yod pa'i bdag po dang bral zhing mi ldan pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin te de'i rnam par dbye ba med pa dang / dbye ba yod pa'i bdag po dang bral zhing mi ldan pa ste /
translated: That is, because of the absence of the distinction of that, because of the absence of the distinction of that, the self is without distinction, without difference.

original: sems las tha dad pa'i phyi rol ba med do zhes sngar bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: sems las tha dad pa'i phyi rol ba med do zhes sngar bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: It has been established above that there is no external reality separate from the mind.

original: de bas na dbye ba dang dbye ba med pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas gzhan du 'dzin pa las rnam par ldog pa'i phyir ci yang dbye ba med pa dang / dbye ba yod pa yin par mi 'dod pa yin no //🔽de ltar bshad ma thag pa'i tshul gyis brtags shing yongs su bsgoms nas rang gi snying ga'i ye shes sems dpa'i thugs kar de kho na nyid dri ma med pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor der gnas pa'i mtshan ma'i dbus na 'dug pa'i snying po dam pa yongs su
analyzed: de bas na dbye ba dang dbye ba med pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas gzhan du 'dzin pa las rnam par ldog pa'i phyir ci yang dbye ba med pa dang / dbye ba yod pa yin par mi 'dod pa yin no // de ltar bshad ma thag pa'i tshul gyis brtags shing yongs su bsgoms nas rang gi snying ga'i ye shes sems dpa'i thugs kar de kho na nyid dri ma med pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor der gnas pa'i mtshan ma'i dbus na 'dug pa'i snying po dam pa yongs su
translated: Therefore, since it is free from the concepts of difference and non-difference, it is free from the grasping of other. It is not accepted that there is no difference at all, nor that there is a difference.

original: gyur pa'i thig le'i gzugs su rang gi yid de rang gi sems 'od dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: gyur pa'i thig le'i gzugs su rang gi yid de rang gi sems 'od dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Having examined and thoroughly contemplated in the manner just explained, one should contemplate and imagine one's mind, the gnosis being at the heart, in the center of the stainless moon disc of reality that abides there, in the center of the sign, in the form of a drop that is the transformation of the sublime essence.🔽It is endowed with light,

original: 'bar ba dang bcas par yongs su bsgom zhing bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bar ba dang bcas par yongs su bsgom zhing bsam par bya'o //
translated: together with radiance.

original: yang na rang gi snying po ni rang gi 'dod pa'i lha'i sa bon te /
analyzed: yang na rang gi snying po ni rang gi 'dod pa'i lha'i sa bon te /
translated: Or, one’s essence is the seed of one’s chosen deity.

original: de'i gzugs su rang gi yid gsang sngags dam par yongs su gyur pa'i thig le'i gzugs su bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i gzugs su rang gi yid gsang sngags dam par yongs su gyur pa'i thig le'i gzugs su bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on the form of that, the form of the drop, which is the transformation of one’s mind into the excellent mantra.

original: thig le'i gzugs can gyi sems de'i 'od zer gyi phreng ba des sad cing snang bar byas pa ste /
analyzed: thig le'i gzugs can gyi sems de'i 'od zer gyi phreng ba des sad cing snang bar byas pa ste /
translated: One’s mind in the form of the drop is awakened and illuminated by the garland of light rays from that.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i lus ni mchog tu gyur pa ste dam par gyur pa'i 'jam pa'i rdo rje'i mthar thug par lus snang bar byas nas ba spu'i bu ga re re nas 'od zer gyi tshogs dpag tu med cing tshad med pas kun du ste
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i lus ni mchog tu gyur pa ste dam par gyur pa'i 'jam pa'i rdo rje'i mthar thug par lus snang bar byas nas ba spu'i bu ga re re nas 'od zer gyi tshogs dpag tu med cing tshad med pas kun du ste
translated: Having illuminated the supreme, that is, the excellent, body of Vajra Body, Speech, and Mind, the body of Mañjuvajra, with light rays from each pore,

original: / dngos po thams cad kyis 'gro ba sna tshogs khyab par byas shing gang bar byas la /
analyzed: / dngos po thams cad kyis 'gro ba sna tshogs khyab par byas shing gang bar byas la /
translated: one should pervade, fill, all migrating beings with an immeasurable, limitless mass of light rays.

original: sems rin po che'i 'od kyi phreng ba can de slar yang zig le'i gzugs de nyid du sems zhugs par gyur cing chud par byas la /
analyzed: sems rin po che'i 'od kyi phreng ba can de slar yang zig le'i gzugs de nyid du sems zhugs par gyur cing chud par byas la /
translated: Having again caused that mind, which has a garland of light rays, to enter and to be absorbed into that very form of the drop,🔽one should meditate on the mind in the form of the drop.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi gzugs ye shes kyi bdud rtsi gnyis su med pa /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi gzugs ye shes kyi bdud rtsi gnyis su med pa /
translated: The form of nondual intuition is the nondual intuition nectar.

original: gsung dang sku dang rdo rje'i lus dang gnyis ka'i mthar yang shes rab dam pa bdag med pa'i ye shes de la goms par byas ba de med par sangs rgyas nyid du mi 'gyur bas sems can thams cad bdag gis sangs rgyas su byas so zhes snying rjes🔽smon par byed pa dang / bdag med pa las goms par byas @224b pa'i shes rab dam pas zin par gyur pas ye shes de dbab pa'i dang tshul gang la yod pa de ni ye shes bdud rtsi dbab pa ste /
analyzed: gsung dang sku dang rdo rje'i lus dang gnyis ka'i mthar yang shes rab dam pa bdag med pa'i ye shes de la goms par byas ba de med par sangs rgyas nyid du mi 'gyur bas sems can thams cad bdag gis sangs rgyas su byas so zhes snying rjes smon par byed pa dang / bdag med pa las goms par byas @224b pa'i shes rab dam pas zin par gyur pas ye shes de dbab pa'i dang tshul gang la yod pa de ni ye shes bdud rtsi dbab pa ste /
translated: The body of speech, body of reality, and vajra body are all at the end of the two, and the supreme wisdom of selflessness is the intuition that is cultivated in them. Since without that there is no buddhahood, one should aspire with compassion, thinking, “I will make all sentient beings buddhas.”🔽The supreme wisdom of selflessness is cultivated in them, and since it is embraced, it is the descent of the nectar of intuition.

original: des reg pas gnyis su med pa'i ye shes dang ldan par gyur to zhes de bsdam par bya'o //
analyzed: des reg pas gnyis su med pa'i ye shes dang ldan par gyur to zhes de bsdam par bya'o //
translated: The one who has the method of descending that intuition is touched by it, and one should bind it, thinking, “I have the nondual intuition.”

original: 'di tsam gyis ni thig le'i rnal 'byor bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis ni thig le'i rnal 'byor bshad pa yin no //
translated: This much explains the drop yoga.

original: yang na rang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la lha'i mtshan ma phra mo rang gi rig ma'i sna'i rtse mor zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa 'od zer dang bcas pa'i thub pa'i 'khor lo'i nang du chud par bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: yang na rang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la lha'i mtshan ma phra mo rang gi rig ma'i sna'i rtse mor zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa 'od zer dang bcas pa'i thub pa'i 'khor lo'i nang du chud par bsgom par bya ste /
translated: Or else, one's own and so forth: One should meditate on the subtle divine sign at the tip of one's nose, abiding in the moon-disk, together with light-rays, and contained within the wheel of the Sage.

original: de yang snying rje rgyur gyur pas na rang gi shes rab dam pa yang dag par gzung ba nyin mtshan du rtag tu bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang snying rje rgyur gyur pas na rang gi shes rab dam pa yang dag par gzung ba nyin mtshan du rtag tu bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, since compassion is the cause, one should meditate day and night on one's own sublime wisdom, which is to be upheld.

original: phra mo'i rnal 'byor brtan por gyur pa'i mtshan ma smig rgyu dang 'dra ba dang po ste /
analyzed: phra mo'i rnal 'byor brtan por gyur pa'i mtshan ma smig rgyu dang 'dra ba dang po ste /
translated: The sign of the firm yoga of the subtle is the first, like a mirage.

original: du ba lta bu gnyis pa yin //
analyzed: du ba lta bu gnyis pa yin //
translated: The second is like smoke.

original: mkha' lta snang ba gsum pa yin //
analyzed: mkha' lta snang ba gsum pa yin //
translated: The third is like the light in the sky.

original: mar me ltar 'bar bzhi pa'o //🔽sprin med nam mkha' lta bur ni //
analyzed: mar me ltar 'bar bzhi pa'o // sprin med nam mkha' lta bur ni //
translated: The fourth is like a blazing lamp.

original: rtag tu snang ba lnga pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu snang ba lnga pa'o //
translated: The fifth is always the appearance like the cloudless sky.

original: zhes bya ba 'di lta bu'i mtshan ma brtan bor mthong nas spro bar bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di lta bu'i mtshan ma brtan bor mthong nas spro bar bya ste /
translated: Having seen such a sign firmly, one should expand.

original: mtshan ma phra mo'i 'od zer las byung ba'i thub pa'i dbang po dang rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i phyag mtshan bsnams te /
analyzed: mtshan ma phra mo'i 'od zer las byung ba'i thub pa'i dbang po dang rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i phyag mtshan bsnams te /
translated: The lords of the sages arise from the light rays of the subtle signs, and they hold various implements.

original: ral gri dang rdo rje dang 'khor lo la sogs pa spro bar bya ste /
analyzed: ral gri dang rdo rje dang 'khor lo la sogs pa spro bar bya ste /
translated: One should emit the sword, the vajra, the wheel, and so forth.

original: 'di tsam gyis ni phra mo'i rnal 'byor bshad pa yin no ;🔽/ de'i rjes thogs la bzlas brjod byas pa yin pas ji ltar bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis ni phra mo'i rnal 'byor bshad pa yin no ; / de'i rjes thogs la bzlas brjod byas pa yin pas ji ltar bya ba ni /
translated: This much explains the subtle yoga.🔽Next, one should perform the recitation.

original: yang na bzlas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /🔽rtse gcig pa dang ldan pa'i sems nyid ni dngos po ma lus pa kun gyi bdag nyid de rang gi sems kyi rgyal po la /
analyzed: yang na bzlas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te / rtse gcig pa dang ldan pa'i sems nyid ni dngos po ma lus pa kun gyi bdag nyid de rang gi sems kyi rgyal po la /
translated: As for how one should do that, it is as [the Bhagavān] declares, “recitation” and so forth.🔽The mind itself endowed with one-pointedness is the nature of all things without exception.

original: bdag gi sems 'di nyid dkyil 'khor ma lus pa'i 'khor lo lta bu yin gyis 'di las phyi rol du gyur pa yod pa ma yin no zhes nges par byas la /
analyzed: bdag gi sems 'di nyid dkyil 'khor ma lus pa'i 'khor lo lta bu yin gyis 'di las phyi rol du gyur pa yod pa ma yin no zhes nges par byas la /
translated: One should ascertain that one’s mind itself is like the wheel of the entire maṇḍala and that nothing exists outside of it.

original: sna tshogs pa'i 'od dang ldan pa ste sna tshogs pa'i 'od zer dang bcas pa'i rang gi sngags ye shes sems dpa'i thugs kar gnas pa rang rang gi 'khor la sogs pa'i thugs kar gnas pa la yi ge dbus su chud par byas pa blo dang ldan pa
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i 'od dang ldan pa ste sna tshogs pa'i 'od zer dang bcas pa'i rang gi sngags ye shes sems dpa'i thugs kar gnas pa rang rang gi 'khor la sogs pa'i thugs kar gnas pa la yi ge dbus su chud par byas pa blo dang ldan pa
translated: One should visualize the mantra of the gnosis being, endowed with various lights, that is, together with various light rays, abiding in the heart of the gnosis being, abiding in the heart of one’s retinue, and so on, with the syllable in the center, the wise one,

original: ste mkhas pas bsam par bya zhing bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: ste mkhas pas bsam par bya zhing bsgom par bya'o //
translated: the intelligent one, should visualize it.

original: bzlas pa 'di ji ltar bya ba de ltar bstan par bya ba'i phyir srog dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽srog dang rtsol ba ma bsdams par gsang sngags kyi rgyal po'i 'od zer @225a * //
analyzed: bzlas pa 'di ji ltar bya ba de ltar bstan par bya ba'i phyir srog dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / srog dang rtsol ba ma bsdams par gsang sngags kyi rgyal po'i 'od zer @225a * //
translated: In order to teach how this recitation is to be done, he says life-force and so on.

original: sna tshogs pa dang ldan pa bsams la /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa dang ldan pa bsams la /
translated: Without restraining the life-force and exertion, one should visualize the king of mantras, endowed with various light rays,

original: sku la sogs pa spro bar bya'o zhes bya bar spyar ro //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa spro bar bya'o zhes bya bar spyar ro //
translated: and emanate the body and so on.

original: ji ltar spro bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar spro bar bya zhe na /
translated: How is it emanated?
